TextDefinition: TextDefinition
A <10-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 10 cylinders
A <12-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 12 cylinders
A <16-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 16 cylinders
A <18-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 18 cylinders
A <1-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 1 cylinder
A <20-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 20 cylinders
A <2-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 2 cylinders

A <2-STROKE ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that uses a 2-stroke working cycle. The charge being introduced by a blower or by other means, compressed, ignited, expanded and exhausted through ports in the cylinder wall (uncovered by the piston), before and during the entry of a new fresh charge. All 4 are achieved in one revolution

A <2-STROKE TRUNK ENGINE> is a <2-STROKE ENGINE> that is a diesel engine were the piston is direct coupled to the crank through the connecting rod. The connecting rod is directly connected to the piston by a piston pin. The combustion air is compressed by the descending piston in a separate crankcase compartment for each cylinder and enters the cylinder through the intake ports as they are uncovered by the piston.
A <3-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 3 cylinders
A <4-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 4 cylinders
A <4-CYLINDER ENGINE WITH FIRING ORDER 1-3-4-2> is a <4-CYLINDER ENGINE> that is designed to have a firing order 1-3-4-2
A <4-STROKE ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that uses a 4-stroke working cycle; suction, compression, explosion, expansion and exhaust, occupying 2 revolutions of the crankshaft

A <4-STROKE TRUNK ENGINE> is a <4-STROKE ENGINE> that is a diesel engine were the piston is direct coupled to the crank through the connecting rod. The connecting rod is directly connected to the piston by a piston pin. The combustion air enters the cylinder through vales on top of the cylinder
A <5-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 5 cylinders
A <6-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 6 cylinders
A <6-CYLINDER ENGINE WITH FIRING ORDER 1-2-4-6-5-3> is a <6-CYLINDER ENGINE> that is designed to have a firing order 1-2-4-6-5-3
A <6-CYLINDER ENGINE WITH FIRING ORDER 1-3-5-6-4-2> is a <6-CYLINDER ENGINE> that is designed to have a firing order 1-3-5-6-4-2
A <6-CYLINDER ENGINE WITH FIRING ORDER 1-5-3-6-4-2> is a <6-CYLINDER ENGINE> that is designed to have a firing order 1-5-3-6-4-2
A <7-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 7 cylinders
A <8-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 8 cylinders
A <9-CYLINDER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that has 9 cylinders

An <ABRADABLE SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> that is provided with abradable materials to reduce clearances with minimum risk to turbine or compressor components during rubs. It is made of a abradable material so that seal wears out in motion and not the other component which is in contact with it. It is a sacrificial part
An <ABRADABLE STATIC LABYRINTH SEAL> is an <ABRADABLE SEAL> and a <STATIC LABYRINTH SEAL>. The abradable part is static.
An <ACTIVATED SLUDGE PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <ACTIVATED SLUDGE>. It is a regular centrifugal pump with open impellers.
An <ACTIVE MAGNETIC RADIAL BEARING> is a <RADIAL BEARING> and a <MAGNETIC BEARING> that uses actively controlled magnetic forces to support the load without shaft-to-bearing contact

An <ACTIVE MAGNETIC THRUST BEARING> is a <THRUST BEARING> and a <MAGNETIC BEARING> that uses actively controlled magnetic forces to accommodate for any residual axial load within any rotating equipment design under all possible operating conditions
An <ACTUATOR STEM SEAL> is a <SHAFT SEAL> that is a sealing element intended to prevent leakage of fluids/gas from the path between stem and surrouding housing
An <ADAPTER SEAT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> for the bottom part of the column in which the cryogenic pump is housed

An <ADJUSTABLE RIGID COUPLING> is a <FLANGED RIGID COUPLING> with a threaded adjusting ring placed between the two flanges making it possible to position the driven shaft axially with respect to the driver.

An <ADJUSTABLE SPEED BELT DRIVE> is a <MECHANICAL ADJUSTABLE SPEED DRIVE> utilizing a rubber-belt or steel-belt running between adjustable pitch-sheaves to convert constant input speed to a variable output speed
An <ADJUSTABLE SPEED GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> where the output speeds may be selected from several different pre-set ranges

An <ADJUSTABLE STATOR VANE> is a <STATOR VANE> by which the adjustment of the play separating the stators and the rotors is effected automatically and jointly with adjustment of the phase angle of the stators.
An <AERATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <AERATING>. It is used to pass bubbles of air or gas through any liquid or semi solid medium

An <AERO GAS GENERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GENERATOR> that is the high-pressure compressor/combustion/turbine section of a gas turbine which supplies a high-energy flow for turbines which drive propellers, fans or compressors
An <AERO-DERIVATIVE GAS TURBINE> is a <GAS TURBINE> that is an industrial turbine derived from an aircraft turbine, which is used for land based industrial applications with modifications
An <AGITATOR> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that stirs or shakes fluids by reaction force from moving vanes
An <AGITATOR GAS SEAL> is a <DRY GAS SEAL> that is designed for low/ medium speed agitator applications.
An <AIR BALANCING UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER> where counterbalance is provided by a pneumatic cylinder charged with air, eliminating the need for counterweights
An <AIR BLOWER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOWER> intended to compress air
An <AIR COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> for increasing the pressure of air
An <AIR COOLED CYLINDER HEAD> is an <AIR COOLED OBJECT> and a <CYLINDER HEAD> which is cooled by air and not liquid
An <AIR COOLED MOTOR> is a <MOTOR> and an <AIR COOLED OBJECT> having fins & fan at the end for air cooling.
An <AIR DRIVEN PISTON PUMP> is a <PISTON PUMP> that is driven by pressurized air.
An <AIR HANDLING UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AIR HANDLER> that is intended for central conditioning and pressure increase of ventilation air

SuperClass: MOTOR, PNEUMATIC TO ROTATION ENERGY CONVERTER
TextDefinition: An <AIR MOTOR> is a <MOTOR> and a <PNEUMATIC TO ROTATION ENERGY CONVERTER> where air is expanded to obtain rotating motion.
An <AIR START SYSTEM> is a <PNEUMATIC START SYSTEM> that uses compressed air as power source to start a driver.
An <AIR STARTER MOTOR> is a <PNEUMATIC MOTOR> and a <STARTER>  using compressed air as the power source
An <AIR-BALANCED UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUNTERBALANCE> on a <PUMPJACK> that is provided by a pneumatic cylinder charged with air from a compressor, eliminating the need for counterweights
An <AIRCRAFT ENGINE> is an <ENGINE> that is a driver which is the power unit of an aircraft
COMPRESSED AIR PUMP
An <ALKALINE PUMP> is a <PUMP> that has some modifications to handle alkaline fluids.
An <AMMONIA INFIX SYSTEM> is a <CHEMICAL INJECTION SYSTEM> that is mainly used for controlling the p<H->value for feed water into boilers.
An <ANCHOR TYPE IMPELLER> is a <RADIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER> that is a contoured, two-bladed impeller for mixing of high viscosity liquids.
An <ANGULAR CONTACT BALL BEARING> is a <BALL BEARING> with raceways in the inner and outer rings which are displaced with respect to each other in the direction of the bearing axis.
An <ANNULUS> is a <Feature> defined as the space between the OD of the inner sealing element and the ID of the outer sealing element of a concentric piping configuration
An <ANTI FRICTION BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that uses rolling bearing elements. Rolling elements can be balls, cylinders, etc
An <API 682 SEAL PIPING PLAN> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL PRODUCT LUBRICATION SYSTEM> that is also a seal leakage containment system, that is in accordance with API 682
An <ARCHIMEDIAN SCREW> is an <ARTEFACT>and a <PUMP> consisting of a deep thread which runs in a cylinder or half a cylinder
An <ARCHIMEDIAN SCREW PUMP> is a <SCREW PUMP> that uses an archimedian screw rotating within a cylindrical trough to lift a fluid.
An <ARMOURED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is protected from impact loads
An <ASH PUMP> is a <PUMP>having special features for <PUMPING> <ASH>
An <ASYMMETRICAL CRANKSHAFT> is a <CRANKSHAFT> where the cranks are located asymmetrical.

An <AUGER EXTRUDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EXTRUDER> that operates in a continuous process. Typically using a screw to build up pressure in the melt. It can incorporate a mixing stage with a forming stage

UniqueName: AUTOMATIC EXTRACTION BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE
TextDefinition: An <AUTOMATIC EXTRACTION BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE> is an <EXTRACTION BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE> where extraction takes place with a system for controlling the pressures of the extracted steam
An <AUTOMATIC EXTRACTION CONDENSING STEAM TURBINE> is an <EXTRACTION CONDENSING STEAM TURBINE> in which extraction takes place with a system for controlling the pressures of the extracted steam
An <AUTOMATIC TROUGH PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> into an animal drinking trough and starting automatically
An <AUXILIARY BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is a specifically designed to provide support in case of failure of the main bearings or bearing system
An <AUXILIARY BRAKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRAKE> that is a supplemental brake for assisting a <MECHANICAL BRAKE>
An <AUXILIARY GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is meant to serve either during start-up or during off-standard operation conditions
An <AUXILIARY IMPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMPELLER> that is used to control the internal pressure and flow in the pump
A <AUXILIARY INLET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID INLET PORT> that receives a fluid and that is not the main fluid inlet port
A <AUXILIARY OUTLET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> that receives a fluid and that is not the main fluid outlet port
An <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that is part of a larger system and and a function which is necessary for the larger system, but which is not part of the function of the larger system
An <AXIAL BLOWER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOWER> in which the flow direction is parallel to the shaft

An <AXIAL COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> in which the gas is accelerated by the action of a bladed rotor and where the main flow is along the rotation axis of the rotor; action of rotating bladed rotor & fixed stator
An <AXIAL DIFFUSER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DIFFUSER> intended for an axial flow machine where the pumped flow or compressed gas is guided axially either to the next stage or to the outlet
An <AXIAL FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> where the flow is along axis of shaft and the pressure ratio is relatively low
An <AXIAL FLOW GAS TURBINE> is a <GAS TURBINE> in witch the gas flow is along the rotation axis of the rotor
An <AXIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER> is a <MIXER IMPELLER> intended to produce flow parallel to the impeller shaft with relatively less shear and higher flow rates in mixing fluids.
An <AXIAL FLOW PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is provided with an axial flow impeller to generate relatively low head at large flows

An <AXIAL FLOW PUMP IMPELLER> is a <PUMP IMPELLER> where the flow direction is along the shaft axis and the flow is discharged nearly axially by which most of the head is developed by the propelling or lifting action of the vanes on the liquid.

UniqueName: AXIAL FLOW PUMP WITH ADJUSTABLE BLADES
TextDefinition: An <AXIAL FLOW PUMP WITH ADJUSTABLE BLADES> is an <AXIAL FLOW PUMP> with impeller blades that can be adjusted to regulate the pump capacity (to provide the desired combination of flow and head).

UniqueName: AXIAL FLOW PUMP WITH REVERSIBLE BLADES
TextDefinition: An <AXIAL FLOW PUMP WITH REVERSIBLE BLADES> is an <AXIAL FLOW PUMP> with impeller blades that can be reversed (for the purpose of changing the flow direction).

UniqueName: AXIAL FLOW PUMP WITH VARIABLE PITCH BLADES
TextDefinition: An <AXIAL FLOW PUMP WITH VARIABLE PITCH BLADES> is an <AXIAL FLOW PUMP> that has blades with pitch which can be varied during operation.
An <AXIAL HYDRAULIC REACTION TURBINE> is a <HYDRAULIC REACTION TURBINE> where the flow path of the liquid is mainly parallel to the axis of rotation
An <AXIAL LABYRINTH SHAFT SEAL> is a <LABYRINTH SHAFT SEAL> where the labyrinth chambers are located axially alongside the shaft.
An <AXIAL PISTON PUMP> is a <PISTON PUMP> utilizing reciprocating pistons in cylinders where valving is achieved by rotating the cylinders and pistons relative to the ports.
An <AXIAL SPLIT CASING> is a  <CASING> where the split surface is through the axis or near the axis
An <AXIAL TURBINE MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> where the flow moves parallel to the impeller shaft
An <AXIAL VIBRATION DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VIBRATION DAMPER> that absorbes and/or prevent axial vibrations to be transmitted through a rotating shaft
An <AXIALLY SPLIT PUMP CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> that is axially split.
A <BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE> is a <STEAM TURBINE> where the exhaust is above atmospheric pressure

A <BACK PULLOUT PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> and a design that allows the wet end of the pump to be left on the piping, while the back end with shaft end, seals, couplings, drivers, etc. can be dismantled for inspection, service, maintenance and overhaul
A <BACKSTOP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIMITER> intended to permit a motor, engine or any rotating apparatus to rotate in its intended direction only

A <BACK-TO-BACK COMPRESSOR> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> divided in a low pressure and high pressure stage, where the compressor impellers in the two stages are facing different ends of the common shaft to eliminate the thrust force.
A <BACK-UP SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <SEAL> that is an auxiliary seal arrangement in order to prevent leakage in case of primary seal failure
A <BAFFLE SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that supports a <BAFFLE>
A <BALANCE COUNTER DISC> is a <DISC> and a <BALANCER> intended to balance the shaft and is attached to a <SHAFT>
A <BALANCE DISC ASSEMBLY> is a <THRUST BALANCE ASSEMBLY> that contains a disc assembly
A <BALANCE DISC SHEET> is a <SHEET> attached to a casing to form part of a balancing disk assembly.
A <BALANCE DRUM> is a <HYDRAULIC CYLINDER> the piston of which is attached to the shaft to form part of a balance drum assembly
A <BALANCE DRUM ASSEMBLY> is a <THRUST BALANCE ASSEMBLY> which contains a drum assembly
A <BALANCE LINER> is a <LINER> inserted in the casing to form part of a balance drum assembly
A <BALANCE PISTON> is a <PISTON> used to balance axial thrust generated by the impellers
A <BALANCE PISTON COMPRESSOR> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> where a piston is attached to the rotor and by means of the pressure difference reduces or eliminates the wear on the thrust bearings
A <BALANCE PISTON COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that covers the sleeve bearing and balancing piston housing
A <BALANCE PISTON DIAPHRAGM> is a <DIAPHRAGM> intended to separate flow at a <BALANCE PISTON>
A <BALANCE PISTON LABYRINTH SEAL> is a <LABYRINTH SEAL> intended to minimize internal recirculation off the balancing piston

A <BALANCE PISTON LOCK NUT> is a <LOCK NUT ASSEMBLY> that is either a nut with an integral part to prevent accidental loosening, or an assembly of a nut and other physical objects that prevent accidental loosening
A <BALANCED MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> arrangement whereby the effect of the hydraulic pressure in the seal chamber has a minor influence on the seal face closing forces.

A <BALANCING BUS> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER> and an <ELECTRICAL NODE>, that is the node of a network the input power of which is controlled so as to equalise the sum of all other input powers and of the active power losses of the network
A <BALANCING CHAMBER> is a <CHAMBER> intended to house a balance disc or drum
A <BALANCING DAMPER is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS FLOW DAMPER> intended to adjust an air flow rate through a duct
A <BALANCING GEAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER>  with rotating weight(s) which reduces internal mass forces in a reciprocating piston engine
A <BALANCING RING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER>   that is a disc or collar intended to be fastened to a pump shaft to balance the thrust from the impellers
A <BALANCING WEIGHT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BALANCER> intended to compensate (counter) unbalanced masses and subsequent dynamic forces
A <BALL> is an <ARTEFACT> with a <SPHERE(shape)> Shape
A <BALL BEARING> is a <ROLLING ELEMENT BEARING> in which the parts are separated by a ring of small freely rotating metal balls which reduce friction.
A <BALL BEARING SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <SWIVEL JOINT> with an integral ball bearing
A <BAR TURBINE IMPELLER> is a <RADIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER> that is multi bladed and bolted or welded to top and bottom of support disk in order to produce high shear rate in mixing fluids.
A <BARE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and  a <PUMP> that is the main component of a <PUMP SYSTEM>
A <BARE TURBINE is a <TURBINE> that is the main component of a <TURBINE SYSTEM>

A <BARREL CASING CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> that has a barrel into which the compressor bundle of multiple stages is inserted. The bundle itself is a horizontally split casing compressor.
A <BARREL ENCLOSURE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> intended to contain either fluids and/or machinery, used in high pressure pumps & compressors.
A <BARREL MOUNTED VERTICAL PUMP CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> intended to be supported vertically inside the pump barrel.
A <BASE FRAME> is a <FRAME>, usually welded, that is acting as the foundation and/or support of a machine or equipment
A <BATCH-LUBE GEAR COUPLING> is an <OIL-LUBRICATED GEAR COUPLING> which is intended to be lubricated by a periodically changed charge of oil
A <BEAM PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is an oil-well pump actuated by a walking beam,
A <BEARING> is a <SUPPORT> intended to support and locate a moving or static element
A <BEARING ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that consists of one or more bearings and associated components
A <BEARING BRACKET> is a <BRACKET> intended to support a bearing assembly
A <BEARING BUSHING> is a <BUSHING> intended to serve as bearing part of a sleeve bearing.
A <BEARING CAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> intended to hold a bearing in position
A <BEARING CARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT>for a bearing assembly
A <BEARING CARTRIDGE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a preassembly of the bearing bracket, bearings, and associated parts for sliding onto a shaft and bolted to a static pump part
A <BEARING CIRCLIP RING> is a <RING> which is a fasteners that grasp elements or installations onto a shaft or in a dwelling/bore when assembled in a groove
A <BEARING COMPONENT> is a <COMPONENT> that is a part of a <BEARING>
A <BEARING COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> intended to protect the bearing from water or air ingress, which would impede the correct working

A <BEARING DEFLECTOR> is a <BEARING COMPONENT> that is a disc-mounted on a shaft and intended to deflect oil from coming out of a bearing and to prevent foreign material, like dirt, from entering a bearing.
A <BEARING DRIVEN END> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is located at the driven end of an equipment
A <BEARING HEAD> is a <BEARING HOUSING> that contains bearing assemblies for male- and female rotor shafts. Typically used in screw pumps and screw compressors.
A <BEARING HOUSING> is a <HOUSING> intended to support a bearing and also store lube oil as a reservoir
A <BEARING HOUSING END COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> intended to cover a bearing housing at non-driven shaft end
A <BEARING HOUSING END SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> intended to retain oil in the housing and prevent entry of foreign material
A <BEARING HOUSING O-RING> is an <O-RING> intended to prevent leakage of oil
A <BEARING HOUSING VENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATING DEVICE>
A <BEARING LOCKNUT> is a <NUT>  used to secure bearings onto a shaft and is designed to prevent the loosening of components due to vibration and rotation
A <BEARING LUBRICATION RING> is a <LUBRATION RING> intended to lubricate a bearing. Its a ring mounted on the rotating shaft and which supplies oil to the bearings.
A <BEARING NON-DRIVEN END> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is located at the non driven end of an equipment

A <BEARING PAD> is a <BEARING COMPONENT> that is a segment of a bearing sleeve, mounted in a housing being able to tilt to the most naturally appropriate angle for lubricant to accept the bearing load between the pads and the shaft or thrust disc. Can be applied to both thrust and radial bearings.
A <BEARING PEDESTAL MOUNTED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that can be mounted on a bearing pedestal. The bearing pedestal is typically needed for long-coupled direct drive
A <BELLOW MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> utilising flexible metal or rubber bellows to act both as pusher spring and to provide secondary sealing.
A <BELLOW SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> utilizing metallic bellows to control seal face contact
A <BELLOWS PUMP> is a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> where a deformable bellow make form of a chamber with non-return valves on the inlet and outlet
A <BELT DRIVE> is a <TRANSMISSION> using pulleys and belts to transmit power
A <BELT DRIVEN PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is driven by a belt
A <BEND RESTRICTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEND LIMITER> having a mechanical stop to limit the local radius of curvature of a flexible pipe, cable or umbilical to a minimum value
A <BETWEEN BEARINGS CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the impeller or impellers are mounted on a shaft between bearings.

A <BEVEL GEAR> is a <GEAR> where the axes of the two shafts intersect and the tooth-bearing faces of the gears themselves are conically shaped. Bevel gears are most often mounted on shafts that are 90 degrees apart, but can be designed to work at other angles as well

UniqueName: BEVELLED END SWIVEL JOINT TYPE 30 LONG RADIUS LOW-PRESSURE
SuperClass: SWIVEL JOINT STYLE 30 LR BEVELLED END
TextDefinition: A <BEVELLED END SWIVEL JOINT TYPE 30 LONG RADIUS LOW-PRESSURE> is a <SWIVEL JOINT STYLE 30 LR BEVELLED END> rated at 1000 psi cold working pressure
A <BIDIRECTIONAL MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> that allows bidirectional rotation, i.e can rotate both clockwise and counterclockwise.
A <BIDIRECTIONAL PNEUMATIC MOTOR> is a <PNEUMATIC MOTOR> capable of delivering rotary motion in two in two directions.
A <BIOCIDE INFIX SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM> intended for loading, storage, pumping and distribution of <BIOCIDE>
A <BLOWER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <BLOWING> a medium volume flow
A <BOILER FEED WATER PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <BOILER FEED WATER>
A <BOILER FEEDWATER PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP>  specially designed for pumping <BOILER FEEDWATER>
A <BOLTING ASSEMBLY> is an <ASSEMBLY> of <BOLT>s, <NUT>s, <WASHER>s <SPLIT PIN>s, etc
A <BOREHOLE FLUSHING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <FLUSHING> a borehole
A <BOREHOLE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> where either the pump and driver (electric or hydraulic ) are immersed in the borehole or the pump is rod driven from the surface
A <BOREHOLE RECIPROCATING PUMP> is a <BOREHOLE PUMP> and a <RECIPROCATING PUMP>

SuperClass: BOREHOLE PUMP, ELECTRICAL ROTATING MACHINE DESIGNED FOR SHAFT DRIVEN TRANSMISSION
TextDefinition: A <BOREHOLE SHAFT DRIVEN CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <BOREHOLE PUMP> and a <ELECTRICAL ROTATING MACHINE DESIGNED FOR SHAFT DRIVEN TRANSMISSION>
A <BORIC ACID PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <BORIC ACID>
A <BORON INJECTION PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <INJECTING> <BORON>
A <BOTTOM ENTRY MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> intended to be installed at the bottom of a vessel

UniqueName: BOTTOM ENTRY VERTICAL INLET CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
TextDefinition: A <BOTTOM ENTRY VERTICAL INLET CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a bottom vertical inlet entry.
A <BOTTOM VALVE PORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID PORT> that enables a <BOTTOM VALVE> to be attached
A <BOWL CENTRIFUGE> i a <CENTRIFUGE> intended to separate fluids within a bowl
A <BOWL GUIDE BUSHING> is a <GUIDE BUSHING> intended to be situated in a pump bowl.
A <BOWL TYPE CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> that has the shape of a bowl, intended to surround an impeller. The inlet and outlet is respectively the bottom and top end of the bowl.
A <BOXER ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> with an engine block where the cylinders are placed in the horizontal plane, i.e. in a flat cylinder configuration.
A <BOXER ENGINE CYLINDER BLOCK> is a <PISTON ENGINE BLOCK> where the cylinders are placed in the horizontal plane, i.e. in a flat cylinder configurartion.
A <BRACKET MOUNTED CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> intended to be mounted on a purpose-made bracket.
A <BRACKET MOUNTED PUMP CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> suitable for mounting on a purpose-made bracket
A <BRAKE> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <BRAKING>
A <BRAKE BLOCK HOLDER NUT> is a <NUT> fixing the brake block to the brake block holder
A <BRAKE COMPONENT> is a <COMPONENT> that is a part of a <BRAKE> system

A <BRAKE CYLINDER> is a <PISTON CYLINDER> which converts the pressure on the brake pedal to hydraulic pressure by feeding brake fluid into the brake circuit and controlling this according to the mechanical force
A <BRAKE DRUM> is a <BRAKE COMPONENT> that is a steel or cast-iron drum attached to a wheel or shaft so that its motion may be retarded by the application of an external band or internal brake shoes.

A <BRAKE UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRAKE> that is applying resistance to the motion of a body, either to retard it, as with a vehicle brake, or to absorb and measure the power developed in an engine or a motor

A <CRANK PIN> is a <SHAFT> fitted into the webs or arms of a crankthrow, and to which a reciprocating member or connecting rod is attached.
A <CRANK WEB> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that is one of the arms of a crank, usually of flat rectangular section
A <CRANKCASE> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is a casing supporting all motion parts belonging to the crankshaft and serving as oil reservoir too.
A <CRANKCASE BOLTING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> and that includes a set of bolting (bolts/studs and nuts) for connection of the crosshead guide to the crankcase
A <CRANKCASE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is mounted on top of the crankcase to allow maintenance to the crankshaft and auxiliary parts

A <CRANKCASE OIL STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> used to clean oil, which is stored in the crank case reservoir before it goes to the bearings, that is applied in the oil stream to the lube oil pump(s)
A <CRANKCASE STUDS AND NUTS> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> and a <FASTENER> that is studs and nuts that connects the crosshead guide to the crankcase
A <CRANKPIN BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is the connection rod bearing located at the crankshaft side
A <CRANKPIN BEARING BOLTING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FASTENER> and that is the bolting that connects the crankpin bearing cap to the connecting rod big end
A <CRANKSHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is the main drive shaft in equipment of the reciprocating type which converts the rotating motion into a linear one.
A <CRANKSHAFT ASSEMBLY> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is an assembly of a built crankshaft, i.e. of the crank web and the crank jounal.
A <CRANKSHAFT AXIAL BEARING> is a <THRUST BEARING> that is the crankshaft location bearing at the driven side carrying both axial and radial loads.
A <CRANKSHAFT COUNTERWEIGHT> is a <COUNTERWEIGHT> that is a weight connected opposite a crank
A <CRANKSHAFT GEAR> is a <GEAR> that drives the pinion gear of the mechanically driven lube oil pump.
A <CRANKSHAFT MAIN BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is used inside a crankcase to support the crankshaft

A <CRANKSHAFT PINION OIL SEAL> is a <PACKING(seal)> that consists of a stationary outer ring located in the crankcase endcover and a rotating inner ring sealing off the crankcase pinion shaft, driving the lubricator
A <CRANKSHAFT PINION SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is an extension to the crankshaft.
A <CRANKSHAFT WITH COUNTERWEIGHT> is a <CRANKSHAFT> where the crank(s) is/are equipped with counterweight.
A <CRANKSHAFT WITHOUT COUNTERWEIGHT> is a <CRANKSHAFT> that have crank(s) without counterweight.
A <CRANKTHROW> is a <CRANK> that is a portion of an axis bent at right angles, used to communicate motion, or to change reciprocal into rotary motion, or the converse.
A <CRANKTHROW ASSEMBLY> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is an assembly of a built crankthrow, i.e. of the crank webs and the crank pin.

A <CRESCENT PARTITION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that is intended to create and seal cavities between the crescent and the driven gear rotor and idler gear rotor to transport fluid from suction to discharge

A <CROSS FLOW FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> that is usually long in relation to the diameter, so the flow approximately remains two-dimensional away from the ends. The <CFF> uses an impeller with forward curved blades, placed in a housing consisting of a rear wall and vortex wall
A <CROSSED AXIS GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> where the input and output shaft axises are crossing

A <CROSSED CYLINDRICAL ROLLER BEARING> is a <CYLINDRICAL ROLLER BEARING> that has raceways in both the inner and outer ring which are inclined at an angle of 45 degrees to the bearing axis and where cylindrical rollers are arranged alternately at 90 degrees to each other. The rollers have a slightly larger diameter than their length.

A <CROSSHEAD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)>  that is a metal block, usually of the reciprocating type, moving between guides; it prevents the piston from moving from side to side and damaging the piston and cylinder.
A <CROSSHEAD ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that is the assembly of crosshead, i.e. the crosshead, crosshead pin crosshead bearing etc
A <CROSSHEAD BALANCING WEIGHT> is a <BALANCING WEIGHT> that is a weight connected on either side of the crosshead body
A <CROSSHEAD BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that constitute a part of the connection between the crosshead connecting rod and the crosshead pin in a crosshead engine
A <CROSSHEAD CONNECTING ROD> is a <CONNECTING ROD> that is transmitting motion from the crosshead in a crosshead engine to the crank

A <CROSSHEAD ENGINE> is a <2-STROKE ENGINE> that is a diesel engine with crosshead and piston rod design. These type of motors have a stuffing box around the piston rod preventing combusting products from contaminating the crankcase oil system. The air in the space between the piston and the diaphragm carrying the stuffing box is displaced by the descending piston into the cylinder through the intake ports as they are uncovered by the piston.
A <CROSSHEAD FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> that is connected to the crosshead body to accommodate the preloaded piston rod locknut assembly
A <CROSSHEAD GUIDE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GUIDE> intended to house and guide a reciprocating crosshead
A <CROSSHEAD GUIDE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is mounted at the side of the crosshead guide to allow maintenance to the crosshead and auxiliary parts and to serve as a guard

A <CROSSHEAD GUIDE OIL SEAL ASSEMBLY> is an <OIL SEAL> and a <SEAL ASSEMBLY> that is located between the crosshead guide and the distance piece and contains a set of oil scraper rings and springloaded seal rings

A <CROSSHEAD GUIDE OILSEAL ASSEMBLY> is a <PACKING(seal)> that is located between the crosshead guide and the distance piece and contains a set of oil scraper rings and springloaded seal rings as per <OEM> assembly drawing
A <CROSSHEAD GUIDE PARTITION COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is located between crosshead guide and inboard distance piece and contains the oil seal assembly
A <CROSSHEAD PIN BUSHING> is a <BUSHING> that is located inside and connected to the crosshead and moving over the crosshead pin.
A <CROSSHEAD SHOE> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is a replaceable part mounted usually on the bottom and topside of the crosshead and running along the crosshead guide.
A <CROWN GEAR> is a <GEAR> which has teeth that project at right angles to the face of the wheel. In particular, a crown gear is a type of <BEVEL GEAR> where the pitch cone angle is 90 degrees
A <CRUDE OIL LOADING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <OIL SYSTEM> and a <LOADING SYSTEM> for dispatching crude oil
A <CRUDE OIL PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <CRUDE OIL>
A <CRUSHER ELEMENT> is a functional <COMPONENT> of a <CRUSHER>
A <CRYOGENIC EXPANDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EXPANDER> that is intended to expand gas pressure and to lower temperature to well below zero by which energy is generated
A <CRYOGENIC PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> liquids at temperatures well below zero
A <CUP SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> that consists of discs with a shallow cup shape, facing each other in pairs and stacked on to a central rod preventing them from slipping sideways
A <CURTISS TURBINE> is an <IMPULSE STEAM TURBINE> that is provided with one pressure stage, followed by more velocity stages
A <CUTTING OIL PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <CUTTING OIL>
A <CYCLONE> is a <CENTRIFUGAL SEPARATOR> intended to separate by rotation based on difference in densities
A <CYLINDER BLOCK> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is a group of cylinders in a single block of material
A <CYLINDER COVER CRANK END> is a <CYLINDER COVER> that is mounted at cylinder crank end containing the piston rod stuffing box and the cylinder flange connection to the distance piece.
A <CYLINDER COVER HEAD END> is a <CYLINDER COVER> that is mounted at cylinder head-end to among others allow installation and maintenance of inner parts.

A <CYLINDER HEAD> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is a removeable top/part of the cylinder(s) on an internal combustion or steam engine. It may contain valve ports, cobustion chamber(s) and cooling water channels.
A <CYLINDER HEAD ASSEMBLY> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is a cylinder head with valves and valve gear.
A <CYLINDER HEAD BOLT> is a <CYLINDER HEAD FIXATION BOLT> that is fixing the cylinder head of a piston engine to the cylinder.

A <CYLINDER HEAD FIXATION BOLT> is a <BOLT> or stud bolt that is fixing the cylinder head of a piston engine to the engine cylinder. There are two types; tie rods (used on large 2-stroke engines) and cylinder head bolts

A <CYLINDER HEAD SINGLE PIECE ASSEMBLY> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is an assembly of a cylinder head with integrated valves and the belonging valves including mechanism. The assembly may include exhaust valve, fuel injection valve and starting air valve.

UniqueName: CYLINDER HEAD WITH BUILT ON EXHAUST VALVE HOUSING
TextDefinition: A <CYLINDER HEAD WITH BUILT ON EXHAUST VALVE HOUSING> is a <CYLINDER HEAD> with built on exhaust valve housing, i.e. the exhaust valve and hosing is mounted on to the cylinder head.

UniqueName: CYLINDER HEAD WITH BUILT-ON EXHAUST VALVE HOUSING ASSEMBLY
TextDefinition: A <CYLINDER HEAD WITH BUILT-ON EXHAUST VALVE HOUSING ASSEMBLY> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is an assembly of a cylinder head with built on exhaust valve housing and the belonging valves including mechanism. The assembly may include exhaust valve housing, exhaust valve, air inlet valve, fuel injection valve and starting air valve.
A <CYLINDER HEAD WITH INTEGRATED VALVES> is a <CYLINDER HEAD> with integrated valves, i.e. it may have exhaust valve, inlet valve, injection valve and starting air valve integrated.
A <CYLINDER JACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COIL> or cylinder of wrought iron or steel placed round a cylinder liner to support and form a cooling channel or chamber
A <CYLINDER LINER> is a <BUSHING> that is a replaceable bushing inside a cylinder.
A <CYLINDER OIL LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <LUBRICATION OIL SYSTEM> providing lubrication oil to the cylinder(s) in a reciprocating piston engine.
A <CYLINDRICAL BORE COUPLING HUB> is a <COUPLING HUB> that has a cylindrical bore
A <CYLINDRICAL ROLLER BEARING> is a <ROLLER BEARING> that contains one or two rows of rollers, alternatively one row with crossed rollers between the outer and inner ring.

A <CYLINDRICAL ROLLER THRUST BEARING> is a <ROLLER BEARING> that contains a cylindrical roller and cage thrust assembly located between a shaft washer and a housing washer to accommodate for axial loads in one direction.
A <DASHPOT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DAMPER> for damping the movement of a closure member
A <DECANTING CENTRIFUGE> is a <CENTRIFUGE> that separates sediment from a fluid
A <DECANTING CENTRIFUGE DRUM> is a <DRUM> and an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> of a <DECANTING CENTRIFUGE>
A <DECAY HEAT REMOVAL PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <REMOVING> heat after the fluid is used
A <DE-EMULSIFIER INFIX SYSTEM> is a <CHEMICAL INJECTION SYSTEM> that includes service for loading, storage, pumping and distribution of de-emulsifier

A <DEEP GROOVE BALL BEARING> is a <BALL BEARING> that uses balls running in one or two deep uninterrupted raceways in the inner and outer ring to handle higher loads as compared to shallow groove bearings.
A <DEEP GROOVE BALL BEARING ASSEMBLY> is a <BEARING ASSEMBLY> consisting of two or more deep groove ball bearings.

SuperClass: CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, SUBMERSIBLE PUMP, VERTICAL PUMP
TextDefinition: A <DEEPWELL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <VERTICAL PUMP> and a <SUBMERSIBLE PUMP> where pump and its electric or hydraulic driver are immersed and typically installed down in a well hole
A <DEEPWELL PUMP LIQUID SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is intended to separate oil in a submersible electric motor from the pumped product in a well

UniqueName: DEEPWELL PUMP WITH SUBMERSIBLE MOTOR ABOVE IMPELLER
TextDefinition: A <DEEPWELL PUMP WITH SUBMERSIBLE MOTOR ABOVE IMPELLER> is a <DEEPWELL PUMP> where a submersible motor is mounted directly above the impeller(s)

UniqueName: DEEPWELL PUMP WITH SUBMERSIBLE MOTOR BELOW IMPELLER
TextDefinition: A <DEEPWELL PUMP WITH SUBMERSIBLE MOTOR BELOW IMPELLER> is a <DEEPWELL PUMP>where a submersible motor is mounted directly below the impeller(s)
A <DELTA ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> with an engine block where the cylinders forms a delta configuration.
A <DELTA ENGINE CYLINDER BLOCK> is a <PISTON ENGINE BLOCK> where the cylinders forms a delta configuration.

A <DERRICK> is a <SUPPORTING STRUCTURE> that is a kind of crane with a movable pivoted arm for moving heavy weights, for example built over a wellsite to provide support for drilling equipment and a tall mast for raising and lowering drillpipe and casing.

A <DESCALING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <REMOVING> internal fouling and deposits in piping systems, heat exchangers, cooling circuits, water supply systems, etc. Either by flushing, or pumping with descaling chemicals. A descaling pump is consequently used for cleaning purposes; it can be either centrifugal or positive displacement pump

A <DIAPHRAGM COMPRESSOR> is a <RECIPROCATING COMPRESSOR> where compression is achieved through reciprocatory motion of the diaphragm within a chamber by which the compressed gas is fully isolated from any contamination.

A <DIAPHRAGM COUPLING > is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> containing one or more flexible elements in the form of circular plates (diaphragms) that are attached to one part of the coupling at the outer diameter and the other part at the inner diameter; the flexible elements absorb any mis-alignment between input and output shafts
A <DIAPHRAGM LABYRINTH SEAL> is a <LABYRINTH SEAL> in a centrifugal compressor, intended to minimize internal recirculation

A <DIAPHRAGM PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> intended to pump a liquid with a small capacity. This is done by means of thin flexible diaphragms to seal pumped fluid from leakage to atmosphere; flow rate is achieved through reciprocatory motion of the diaphragm

SuperClass: INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE, RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE
TextDefinition: A <DIESEL ENGINE> is  an <INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE> and a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> in which ignition of the fuel injected into the cylinder is performed by the heat of compression of the air charge
A <DIESEL OIL PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <DIESEL OIL>
A <DIESEL PROPULSION ENGINE> is a <PROPULSION ENGINE> and a <DIESEL ENGINE>
A <DIESEL-ELECTRIC PROPULSION ENGINE> is a <PROPULSION ENGINE> that is an engine that drives an electric generator which drives the propulsion system of a ship

A <DIFFERENTIAL PISTON PUMP> is a <CONTROLLED VOLUME PISTON PUMP> that is double acting and typically driven by a pump feeding unit. The delivery rate is proportional with the number of double strokes per minute, which normally is controlled by pneumatically operated valves arranged in a piping system connected to the in- and outlets of the differential piston pump
A <DIFFUSER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <DIFFUSING> which is used in pumps to convert kinetic energy imparted by impeller to potential energy i.e. pressure head.
A <DIFFUSER PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a diffuser type static part

A <DIFFUSOR TYPE CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> where the pump impeller is surrounded by a casing with a set of stationary diffusor vanes to convert parts of the kinetic energy of the liquid into pressure energy.

A <DIRECT ACTING PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> where the pump driver is a piston motor integrally built as part of the pump unit. The piston motor can be driven by compressed gas like steam, air, etc. The pump can be of the double acting or single acting piston, or plunger type.
A <DIRECT ACTING STEAM  PUMP> is a <DIRECT ACTING PUMP> by which the piston motor is driven by pressurized steam

A <DIRECT INJECTION DIESEL ENGINE> is a <DIESEL ENGINE> that is of the direct injection type by which direct fuel injection (DI) takes place into the <ENGINE CYLINDER> ; the diesel engine has no spark plugs
A <DISC BRAKE> is a <MECHANICAL BRAKE> that operates by the friction of two or more pads closed by the caliper action on to a disc which is connected rigidly to the wheel-hub.

A <DISC COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that consists of one or more elements that are alternately attached circumferentially to the two parts of the coupling; the attachment points being substantially at the same radial distance from the axial centerline
A <DISC ROTOR PUMP> is a <ROTARY PUMP> that is using a rotating disc at the end of a shaft to displace liquid from suction to discharge at relatively low heads.
A <DISC THRUST BALANCER> is a <THRUST BALANCE ASSEMBLY> used to absorb thrust generated in the axial direction of the multi stage pump
A <DISCHARGE COLUMN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROCESS COLUMN> with a cylindrical shape in which discharge flow is guided to grade
A <DISCHARGE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a removable part of a pressurized casing with a special shape suitable to serve as discharge outlet
A <DISCHARGE ELBOW> is a <PIPE ELBOW> that is intended to guide a discharge flow. It is mounted on top of a mounting plate as extension of a discharge column.
A <DISCHARGE PIPING SYSTEM> is a <PIPING SYSTEM> that is located at the discharge of subject equipment through which pressurized fluid is transported.

UniqueName: DISCHARGE THROUGH COLUMN LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
TextDefinition: A <DISCHARGE THROUGH COLUMN LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> utilizing the pump column as discharge line
A <DISHWASHER> is a <WHITE GOODS> that is a power-operated machine for washing dishes, cutlery, etc
A <DISTANCE PIECE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEPARATOR> that is located between the crosshead guide and the cylinder to separate the compression part from the lubricated motion parts of the equipment
A <DISTANCE PIECE COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is mounted at side of the distance piece to allow access for maintenance
A <DISTANCE PIECE LIQUID COLLECTION POT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COLLECTOR> and a <CONTAINER> that is intended for use to collect leakage liquid from the outboard distance piece
A <DISTANCE PIECE PARTITION COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is located between the inboard and the outboard distance piece and contains the intermediate partition packing
A <DISTANCE PIECE SEAL ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that consists of 2 sets of springloaded seal rings as per OEM assembly drawing, located between inboard and outboard distance piece
A <DISTANCE RING> is an <ARTEFACT> and <MECHANICAL SEPARATOR> that is used to keep machine parts separated
A <DISTANCE SLEEVE> is an <SLEEVE> that centralizes shaft and compensates length deviations of the shaft due to temperature changes
A <DISTILLATE PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <DISTILLATE>

A <DOUBLE ACTING PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> that as it fills one end of the liquid cylinder, is discharging liquid from the other end of the cylinder. On the return stroke, the end of the cylinder just emtied is filled, and the end just filled is emptied.
A <DOUBLE AXIS SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWIVEL JOINT> which allows two axis of rotation
A <DOUBLE CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> that consists of an axially split inner casing and a radially split outer casing. The suction and discharge nozzles form an integral part of the outer casing.
A <DOUBLE CHANNEL IMPELLER PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> with a double-channel impeller to avoid blockage and clogging
A <DOUBLE DIAPHRAGM PUMP> is a <CONTROLLED VOLUME DIAPHRAGM PUMP> that contains two diaphragms per head
A <DOUBLE DRY GAS SEAL> is a <DRY GAS SEAL> that has two seal faces back to back

A <DOUBLE ENGAGEMENT COUPLING> is a <FLEXIBLE COUPLING> with two planes of flexure. <NOTE>; This arrangement enables couplings of certain types, notably gear and metallic flexible element types, which cannot normally accommodate parallel (or lateral) offset, to do so.
A <DOUBLE ENTRY PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> with a double suction, with two impellers positioned back-to-back,used to reduce the axial thrust and the NPSHr value
A <DOUBLE HELICAL GEARBOX> is a <HELICAL GEARBOX> utilizing gear-wheels with two rows of opposed helical teeth separated by a groove
A <DOUBLE HELICAL MIXER IMPELLER> is a <HELICAL MIXER IMPELLER> that is provided with both a single spiral-shaped blade and an inner flight of similar blade shape.

A <DOUBLE IMPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMPELLER> that is a double-suction impeller that is a more balanced design than a single-suction impeller because the two sides of the impeller balance the axial thrust loads being placed on the impeller, shaft, and bearings
A <DOUBLE MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> that is a seal arrangement in which two mechanical seals are mounted back-to-back or face-to-face in order to retain a buffer fluid in between.
A <DOUBLE ROW ANGULAR CONTACT BEARING> is an <ANGULAR CONTACT BALL BEARING> provided with two rows bearing balls and destined to accommodate for thrust loads in both directions.
A <DOUBLE ROW BEARING> is a <ROLLING ELEMENT BEARING> that contains two rows of rolling elements.
A <DOUBLE SPIRAL> is a <MIXER IMPELLER> that contains a helical inner and a helical outer flight intended to mix highly viscous materials.
A <DOUBLE SUCTION PUMP IMPELLER> is a <PUMP IMPELLER> where the liquid is intended to enter the two suction inlet eyes from both sides.

A <DOUBLE TYPE PUMP CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> where a multistage centrifugal pump is designed with an axially split inner casing and a radially split outer casing. The suction and discharge nozzles form an integral part of the outer casing
A <DOUBLE VOLUTE> is a <VOLUTE> with a guiding vane.
A <DOUBLE VOLUTE PUMP> is a <VOLUTE PUMP> with a double volute casing, where the flow is divided into two equal streams with two cut-waters set 180 degrees apart.

A <DOUBLE VOLUTE TYPE CASING> is a <VOLUTE TYPE CASING> where the oulet channel has a double-volute wall, intended to reduce the radial reaction forces acting on the impeller, especially during operation of the pump at reduced capacity.
A <DRAFT TUBE CIRCULATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> that is vertically installed around a mixer impeller and typically used in case of slurry agitation inside deep tanks
A <DRAIN CONNECTION POINT> is a <FLUID CONNECTION POINT> and a <DRAIN PORT> that allows for <CONNECTING> a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> for any drained <FLUID>
A <DRAIN PORT> is a <LIQUID OUTLET PORT> that allows liquid to drain from a container under gravity
A <DRAINAGE PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <DRAINING> a space
A <DRAWN FLUID PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> intended to transport liquids applying the principle of viscous friction
A <DREDGING PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is designed for <DREDGING>
A <DRILLING MODULE STRUCTURE> is a <MODULE STRUCTURE> for a drilling module.

A <DRILLING STANDPIPE> is a <CONDUIT(tube)> OF rigid metal, that provides the high-pressure pathway for drilling mud to travel approximately one-third of the way up the derrick, where it connects to a <KELLY HOSE>
A <DRIP PAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PAN> that serves to collect and lead waste liquids by gravity to a drain connection
A <DRIP PLATE> is a <PLATE> that serves to collect and lead waste liquids by gravity to a drain connection
A <DRIP RIM> is a <GUTTER> where the rim is located around the base plate or skid
A <DRIVE BELT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> that is an endless belt transferring rotational energy from one pulley to another
A <DRIVE END BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> for a drive end of a driver, i.e. for support of the end of the shaft where torque is transferred
A <DRIVE END RADIAL/THRUST BEARING> is a <DRIVE END BEARING> and a <RADIAL/THRUST BEARING> that is located at a drive end.

A <DRIVE SHAFT> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> that is a shaft used to transfer rotational power from a prime driver to several individual machines by use of drive belts and pulley wheels
A <DRIVEN END BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that can be installed at driven end
A <DRIVEN EQUIPMENT > is a <EQUIPMENT ITEM> that needs a supply of <MECHANICAL ENERGY>
A <DRIVER COLLAR> is a <COLLAR> that is intended to mount and position the shaft sleeve underneath the seal onto the shaft.
A <DRIVER STOOL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <SUPPORT> intended to support a motor
A <DRIVER TO CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is used to connect driver and centrifugal compressor
A <DRIVER TO GEAR COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is a gear coupling that is used to connect driver and gear
A <DRIVE-TO-DRIVEN CONNECTION> is a <ConnectionOfIndividual> between a <DRIVING OBJECT> and a <DRIVEN OBJECT>
A <DROP-FORGED CRANKSHAFT> is a <FORGED CRANKSHAFT> that is produced/formed by letting heated metal be forced into a die.
A <DRUM BRAKE> is a <MECHANICAL BRAKE> that operates by the friction of an external band or internal brake shoe pressing against the brake drum (rotating drum).

A <DRUM WHEEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> used in agriculture and is usually referred to as a Water Wheel Pump it&#226;â¬â¢s a type of Spiral Pump. It uses a water wheel that turns a spiral coil that extracts water from a stream or pond and lifts it
A <DRY CYLINDER LINER> is a <CYLINDER LINER> that is not in contact with the cooling water.
A <DRY DOCK> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> able to contain a ship and to be drained or lifted so as to leave the ship free of water with all parts of the hull accessible for maintenance and/or repair
A <DRY GAS SEAL> is a <COMPRESSOR OR EXPANDER SEAL> that is intended to seal a compressor or expander by means of dry gas. The gas is either filtered discharged process gas or a clean sealing gas.
A <DRY GAS SEAL LOCK NUT> is a <LOCK NUT ASSEMBLY> that fastens a dry gas seal cartridge to a shaft
A <DRY RUNNING SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> that is a main or back-up seal operating without liquid lubrication between its faces.
A <DUAL ACTIVE MAGNETIC THRUST BEARING> is a <THRUST BEARING> and a <MAGNETIC BEARING>  that consists of two opposing magnetic bearings to provide double acting response
A <DUAL FUEL COMBUSTION ENGINE> is an <INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE> that has a dual fuel system, i.e. it can e.g. run on either diesel or gas.

A <DUAL MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> with two sealing faces mounted back to back and with a clean buffer fluid kept circulated in between at a higher pressure than the pump suction pressure (stuffing box pressure). The buffer fluid secures a clean lubricating film between the sliding faces. Buffer fluid leakage across the seal faces has to be compensated.

UniqueName: DUAL MECHANICAL SEAL WITH PUMPING RING
TextDefinition: A <DUAL MECHANICAL SEAL WITH PUMPING RING> is a <DUAL MECHANICAL SEAL> where a pumping ring is mounted between the two seals to boost the circulation of buffer fluid.

UniqueName: DUAL MECHANICAL SEAL WITHOUT PUMPING RING
TextDefinition: A <DUAL MECHANICAL SEAL WITHOUT PUMPING RING> is a <DUAL MECHANICAL SEAL> without a internal pumping ring between the seals. The circulation of buffer fluid is taken care of by an external system.

A <DUPLEX HEAD DIAPHRAGM PUMP> is a <CONTROLLED VOLUME DIAPHRAGM PUMP> that is sealless, using two mechanically or hydraulically actuated diaphragm pump heads. The drive system for the diaphragms is a common rugged triple throw crankshaft / cross head system
A <DUPLEX PUMP> is a <PISTON PUMP> that has two liquid cylinders.The drive system for the pistons or plungers is a common rugged duplex throw crankshaft / crosshead system.
A <DYE PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <DYE>
A <DYNAMIC MIXER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <MIXER> that is exteranally powered
A <DYNAMIC SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is an O-ring sealing the rotating face of non bellows type mechanical seal to the shaft

An <ECCENTRIC FORCE TRANSMITTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> that causes a non-circumferential motion at the outside of a rotating component and either mounted on a wheel, shaft, etc. or part thereof

An <ECCENTRIC HELICAL ROTOR PUMP> is a <SCREW PUMP> that contains one screw-rotor that together with an elastomer stator forms cavities that are transported axially from suction to discharge as the screw-rotor rotates.

An <EDDY-CURRENT ADJUSTABLE TORQUE COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> utilizating a magnetic field set up between the input and output member to obtain variable torque and speed between a constant speed driver and a driven equipment

An <EIGHT STAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> in which the head is developed by eight impellers operating in series (each taking its suction from the discharge of the preceding impeller)

An <ELASTOMERIC COMPRESSION COUPLING> is an <ELASTOMERIC FLEXIBLE ELEMENT COUPLING> in which elastomeric inserts, often in the form of bushes or wedges, or one single insert, are located between adjacent parts of the driving and driven halves of the coupling and are principally loaded in compressio.
An <ELASTOMERIC FLEXIBLE ELEMENT COUPLING> is a <FLEXIBLE COUPLING> in which the torque is transmitted through one or several elastomeric elements.

An <ELASTOMERIC SHEAR COUPLING> is an <ELASTOMERIC FLEXIBLE ELEMENT COUPLING> in which the torque is transmitted through an elastomeric element which is principally loaded in shear. The element may be in form of a tyre, a bellow (with one ore more convolutions) or a diaphragm.
An <ELBOW PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> built inside an elbow
An <ELECTRIC BRAKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRAKE> in which electric energy is generated
An <ELECTRIC FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> powered by an <ELECTRIC MOTOR>
An <ELECTRICAL ROTATING MACHINE FRAME> is a <MACHINE COMPONENT> that is the main static part supporting the stator, rotor and auxilary parts of an electrical rotating machine
An <ELECTRO-ERODED IMPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMPELLER> that constructed and fabricated according the electro eroded methodology
An <ELECTROMAGNETIC BRAKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRAKE> using electro-magnets to produce a braking force
An <ELECTROMAGNETIC PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> intended to transport a conductive liquid. It uses magnetic force which is a result of induced current created by a solenoid
An <ENCLOSED LINE SHAFT> is a <LINE SHAFT> that is intended to run inside a tube (inside the column pipe) isolated from the pumped liquid.
An <ENCLOSED LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a  <LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> provided with an enclosed line-shaft in order to protect the shaft from the pumped medium
An <ENGINE> is a <MOTOR> and a <MACHINE> that converts energy into mechanical force and motion
An <ENGINE ASPIRATOR> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is an apparatus for drawing a stream of air or gas through a tube.
An <ENGINE BLOCK> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is the main cast of an engine, forming the shell around it and holding the parts together.
An <ENGINE COMPONENT> is a <COMPONENT> that is a part of an <ENGINE>
An <ENGINE CYLINDER> is a <MECHANICAL CYLINDER> of an <ENGINE>

An <EPICYCLIC GEAR> is a <GEAR> that consists of two gears mounted so that the centre of one gear revolves around the centre of the other. A carrier connects the centres of the two gears and rotates to carry one gear, called the planet gear or planet pinion, around the other, called the sun gear or sun wheel
An <EPICYCLIC GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> where intermediate gears roll between concentric inner and outer gears
An <EPICYCLIC GEARBOX WITH HANDWHEEL> is an <EPICYCLIC GEARBOX> that can be turned using a handwheel.
An <EPICYCLIC TRAIN> is a <GEAR TRAIN> of epicyclic gear wheels in which at least one wheel axis itself revolves about another fixed axis
An <EXHAUST CASING> is a  <CASING> that guides exhaust gas or steam to downstream equipment or to the atmosphere
An <EXHAUST DIFFUSER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DIFFUSER> that is part of an exhaust system and that is intended to direct the flow
An <EXHAUST HOOD> is a  <CASING> that is intended to serve as turbine outlet and is connected to either the exhaust piping assembly or surface condenser
An <EXHAUST MANIFOLD> is a <MANIFOLD> that consists of a branched pipe which channels burnt gases from combustion chambers on a combustion engine to an exhaust system
An <EXHAUST SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that is capable of handling exhaust gases from combustion engines
An <EXPANDER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of recovering energy by expansion of pressurized fluid
An <EXPANDER IMPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMPELLER> that is an impeller which is installed in a expander
An <EXPANDER SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is intended for application in an expander
An <EXPANDER SEAL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL SYSTEM> that is a configuration of hardware components required to achieve the sealing function of an expander
An <EXPANDER SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <ROTATING EQUIPMENT SYSTEM> that is one or more expanders and related equipment intended to generate power by the process of gas expansion
An <EXPANDER TURBINE DRIVE> is a <TURBINE> and an <EXPANDER> that is a power source driven by energy generated when the pressure in a medium is taken down through a <TURBINE>
An <EXPLOSION PROOF AXIAL FAN> is an <AXIAL FAN> that can be used in areas with risk of explosion from <HYDROCARBONS>
An <EXPLOSION PROOF CENTRIFUGAL FAN> is a <RADIAL FAN> that can be used in areas with risk of explosion from <HYDROCARBONS>
An <EXTENSION SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is a separate shaft, connected to flywheel and crankshaft by pre-stressed bolting, equipped with an outboard pedestal bearing to carry the flywheel weight.
An <EXTERNAL CIRCUMFERENTIAL PISTON PUMP> is a <CIRCUMFERENTIAL PISTON PUMP> in which each rotor has one or more pistons and that requires a timing gear.
An <EXTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE> is a <COMBUSTION ENGINE> that is intended to receive its heat from fuel burning outside the cylinder.

An <EXTERNAL GEAR PUMP> is a <GEAR PUMP> that contains two gear-rotors with externally cut gear teeth meshing to transport liquid. The gear may have spur, helical or herringbone cut gear teeth and may have timing gears.
An <EXTERNAL VANE PUMP> is a <VANE PUMP> that uses a centric mounted oval shaped rotor sliding against a spring-loaded vane in the casing.
An <EXTRACT GRILLE DIFFUSER> is an <HVAC GRILLE> and a <DIFFUSER> that extracts air vertically without any deflection

UniqueName: EXTRACT GRILLE DIFFUSER WITH BALANCING DAMPER
TextDefinition: An <EXTRACT GRILLE DIFFUSER WITH BALANCING DAMPER> is an <EXTRACT GRILLE DIFFUSER> with a balancing damper
An <EXTRACTION BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE> is a <BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE> where steam is extracted from one or more stages
An <EXTRACTION CONDENSING STEAM TURBINE> is a <CONDENSING STEAM TURBINE> where steam is extracted from one or more stages
An <EXTRACTION PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <EXTRACTING> deaerated liquid
An <EXTRUDER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <EXTRUDING>

An <EXTRUDER BARREL> is a <BARREL ENCLOSURE> in an extruder that houses one or more screws. Typically cylindrical. It provides the bearing surface where shear is imparted to the extruded material such as plastic granules.
An <EXTRUSION DRAWN FLUID PUMP> is a <DRAWN FLUID PUMP> that uses a cylindrical or conical spindle to transport liquids.
A <FAN> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <DELIVERING> or <EXHAUSTING> volumes of vapour or gas at low differential pressure
A <FAN BLADE> is a <VANE> suitable for a impeller of a fan.
A <FAN COWLING> is a <COWLING> intended to house and protect a fan.
A <FAN HUB> is a <HUB> that is the central part of a <FAN> which is bored out to receive the shaft
A <FAN IMPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMPELLER> forming part of the rotating assembly of a fan imparting kinetic energy to the air or gas being transported
A <FILTERING CENTRIFUGE> is a <CENTRIFUGE> intended to separate solids from liquids by centrifugal process based on different densities
A <FILTERING CENTRIFUGE DRUM> is a <DRUM> and an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> of a <FILTERING CENTRIFUGE>
A <FIRE DAMPER BLADE> is a <MACHINE COMPONENT> that is the disc or shut off body in a fire damper
A <FIRE FIGHTING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> water for fire fighting purposes
A <FIREWATER VALVE SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> containing valves for firewater distribution
A <FISH PUMP> is a <PUMP> for moving water that contains fish. A fish pump is designed to catch fish, to remove fish from fishing gear, and to transport fish hydraulically at processing enterprises

A <FIVE STAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> in which the head is developed by five impellers operating in series (each taking its suction from the discharge of the preceding impeller)
A <FIXED MULTILOBE RADIAL BEARING> is a <MULTILOBE BEARING> and a <RADIAL BEARING> with fixed lobes
A <FIXED MULTILOBE THRUST BEARING> is a <MULTILOBE BEARING> and a <THRUST BEARING> with fixed lobes
A <FLANGE MOUNTED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> by which the flange as part of the pump casing is the primary supporting part for the pump
A <FLANGED MOTOR PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> by which the electric motor is directly flanged to the pump without the application of a coupling in between

A <FLANGED RIGID COUPLING> is a <RIGID COUPLING> consisting of two flanged rigid members, each mounted on one of the connected shafts. The flanges are provided with a number of bolt holes for the purpose of connecting the two halves.
A <FLANGED TAPERLOCK BOSS> is a <TAPERLOCK BOSS> intended for being screwed on to wheel
A <FLARE MIXING CONE> is a <CONTAINER> and a <MIXER> of conical shape being a part of a <FLARE TIP> designed to mix the gas emitted from a process with air to ensure complete combustion

A <FLARE STACK STRUCTURE> is a <SUPPORTING STRUCTURE> that is an elevated vertical conveyance that is part of installations such as oil and gas wells, oil rigs, refineries, chemical, petrochemical and natural gas plants, and other facilities. On oil- production rigs and in refineries and petrochemical plants, the flare stacks primarily serve to protect vessels or pipes from over-pressuring during unexpected plant upsets.
A <FLAT BLADE IMPELLER> is a <RADIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER>that uses vertical blades connected to a support disc to produce fairly high shear or turbulence in mixing liquids.
A <FLEXIBLE COMPRESSION SLEEVE COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that uses a flexible element generally made of rubber

A <FLEXIBLE COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> used to connect two co-axial shafts in which perfectly rigid alignment is impossible; the torque is transmitted from one flange to another through a resilient member or by gear teeth which also allows a limited end float
A <FLEXIBLE DISC COUPLING> is a <DISC COUPLING> with flexible discs

A <FLEXIBLE LINER PUMP> is a <FLEXIBLE MEMBER ROTARY PUMP> that contains an eccentric slipper or one or more rotating vanes combined with a flexible liner inside the casing to create cavities and to transport liquid from suction to discharge.

A <FLEXIBLE MEMBER ROTARY PUMP> is a <ROTARY PUMP> that contains a flexible member combined with a rotary or stationary non flexible part to create a sealing action to pump liquid from suction to discharge.
A <FLEXIBLE TUBE PUMP> is a <FLEXIBLE MEMBER ROTARY PUMP> that is intended to pump liquid by means of rolling elements over a flexible hose.
A <FLEXIBLE VANE PUMP> is a <FLEXIBLE MEMBER ROTARY PUMP> that contains an eccentric rotor with flexible vanes within a casing to create cavities and transport liquid from suction to discharge.
A <FLEXIBLY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <FLEXIBLE COUPLING>

A <FLINGER LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> with a rotating flinger which is designed to splash oil (and lubricate a bearing) when hitting the oil surface in a oil sump. The flinger is usually fitted to a rotating shaft or crankshaft
A <FLOATING DIAPHRAGM> is a <DIAPHRAGM> that separates the two (2) pump diaphragms and is typically made of elastomer material.
A <FLOATING RING SHAFT SEAL> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR SHAFT SEAL> that is provided with labyrinths and slingers and receives pressurized oil-injection to the rotating seal faces
A <FLOOD LUBRICATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> where the lubricant (oil) is circulated through the bearing without buiding up a pressure
A <FLOOD LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> that is designed to circulate lubricant (oil) through a bearing without building up a pressure
A <FLOODED-MESH GEAR COUPLING> is an <OIL-LUBRICATED GEAR COUPLING> which is continously lubricated as the gear meshes are completely submerged in oil during normal operation
A <FLOW STRAIGHTENING VANE> is a <VANE> and a <DIRECTING OBJECT> that attenuates and minimizes flow eddies, rotation swirls and other undesirable flow patterns upstream of a flow meter
A <FLUID COUPLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUPLER> and a <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> intended to transmit power and act as a clutch and uses fluid while allowing variable speed
A <FLUID INLET PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> with an <INLET> Role through which fluid enters a container
A <FLUID INLET-OUTLET PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> with an <INLET> and an <OUTLET> Role that allows for both entry and exit of a fluid from a fluid container, or for which it has not been defined
A <FLUID OUTLET PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> with an <OUTLET> Role that allows for exit of a fluid from a fluid container
A <FLUID PORT> is a <PORT> that allows for the entry or exit of substances that behave as fluids, i.e. gases, liquids and fluidized solids
A <FLUSHING PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> that allows for an entry or exit of a flushing medium
A <FLUSHING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <FLUSHING>

A <FLYWHEEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WHEEL>that is intended to compensate for non-constant torque characteristics of equipment by adding moment of inertia; It is used to store energy when available and supply it when required, and reduces speed fluctuations
A <FLYWHEEL GUARD> is a <GUARD> that is applied around the flywheel for personel protection.
A <FOOT GEAR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> for feet
A <FOOT MOUNTED CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> that is provided with feet designed for fastening the pump onto a fundament or baseplate.
A <FOOT SUPPORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is intended to fix equipment or equipment parts to the base plate/pedestals etc
A <FOOT-MOUNTED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <FOOT-MOUNTED CASING>
A <FORCED DRAFT FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> that is intended to provide enhanced flow of air by powered means

A <FORCED FEED LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> that is a mechanical system of lubricating internal combustion engines in which a pump forces oil into the engine bearings
A <FORCED VENTILATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATION SYSTEM> that provides forced ventilation
A <FORGED CASING> is a <CASING> that is forged
A <FORGED CRANKSHAFT> is a <SINGLE PIECE CRANKSHAFT> forged out in one piece.
A <FORWARD/REVERSE THRUST GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is capable of supporting forward and reverse thrust
A <FOUNDATION BOLT> is a <BOLT> that is intended to mount either equipment or machinery steel base plates to foundations
A <FOUR AXIS SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWIVEL JOINT> which allows four planes of rotation

A <FOUR LOBE PUMP> is a <LOBE PUMP> that essentially operates similar to external gear pumps, however with higher degree of pulsation (lower then three lobe). The rotors must be driven independently; a small clearance is maintained between lobe surfaces.

A <FOUR STAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> in which the head is developed by four impellers operating in series (each taking its suction from the discharge of the preceding impeller)
A <FRANCIS TURBINE> is a <HYDRAULIC REACTION TURBINE> with fixed runner blades usually operated from a medium or low head source with a medium flow rate
A <FRANCIS-VANE PUMP IMPELLER> is a <MIXED FLOW PUMP IMPELLER> with double curvature vanes extending over the full vane surface and resulting in a low specific speed.
A <FREE FORM FORGED CRANKSHAFT> is a <FORGED CRANKSHAFT> that is produced/formed by hammering heated metal into shape.

A <FRESH WATER PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> fresh water, i.e.any naturally occurring water except seawater and brackish water. Fresh water is generally characterized by having low concentrations of dissolved salts and other total dissolved solids
A <FRESHWATER COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> using fresh water as the medium for heat transfer

A <FRICTION ROLLER ADJUSTABLE SPEED DRIVE> is a <MECHANICAL ADJUSTABLE SPEED DRIVE> utilizating the friction between two rotating discs rolling against each other to convert constant input speed to a variable output speed
A <FRICTION TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> is a <TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> where the turning mass is connected to the driver plate by means of spring loaded friction linings
A <FUEL OIL TRANSFER PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> fuel oil
A <FUEL SUPPLY SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FUEL SYSTEM> intended to deliver fuel to a consumer
A <FUEL SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended for fuel services
A <FULL SPLIT MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <RADIAL SPLIT MECHANICAL SEAL> where the complete seal can be split to make it possible to change parts without dismounting the hole machine.
A <GAS CYCLONE> is a <CYCLONE> and a <GAS-LIQUID SEPARATOR>  and a <GAS-SOLID SEPARATOR>

SuperClass: INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE, RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE
TextDefinition: A <GAS ENGINE> is an <INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE> and a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> in which gaseous fuel is mixed with air to form a combustible mixture in a cylinder which is fired by spark ignition
A <GAS INLET PORT> is a <FLUID INLET PORT> and a <GAS PORT> that allows for entry of a <GASEOUS COMPOUND>
A <GAS LIFT PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFT PUMP> intended to pump liquid on basis of difference in density as a result of gas dispersion (pressurized gas in liquid) and pure liquid

A <GAS LUBRICATED MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> where the sealing faces are wider than on a wet seal and they are lubricated by gas. This is done by providing the sliding faces with V and U grooves which creates a thin gas film between the sliding faces.
A <GAS OIL DIESEL ENGINE> is a <DIESEL ENGINE> designed to run on gas oil.
A <GAS OUTLET PORT> is a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> and a <GAS PORT> that allows gas to exit a container
A <GAS PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> that allows for the entry or exit of a <GAS>
A <GAS PRESSURE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that uses pressurized gas to transport liquid
A <GAS RECOMPRESSION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS COMPRESSION SYSTEM> for scrubbing, recompressing and cooling of gas

A <GAS SCRUBBING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS TREATMENT SYSTEM> including purifying a gas (remove small droplets) by routing the gas through a separator. Often placed upstream compressors. For other purposes the purifying can also be made by putting the gas through water or chemical wash

A <GAS TURBINE> is a <TURBINE> that compresses air which is then mixed with fuel for combustion and expansion through a turbine section to generate relatively high power output for either mechanical drive or power generation

A <GAS TURBINE SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TURBINE SYSTEM> that has an upstream rotating compressor coupled to a downstream turbine, and a combustion chamber or area, called a combustor, in between
A <GEAR is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WHEEL> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> that has teeth which are making contact with a mating gear intended to transfer power
An <GEAR ASSEMBLY> is an <ASSEMBLY>  of one or more <GEAR WHEEL>s and <SHAFT>s

A <GEAR COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL CONTACT COUPLING> designed to transmit torque and accommodate misalignment and axial displacement by relative rocking and sliding motion between mating internal and external profiled gears.
A <GEAR PUMP> is a <ROTARY PUMP> that contains gear teeth within an casing or enclosure to transport liquid at relatively high back pressures
A <GEAR SHIFTER UNIT BRACKET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRACKET> that holds the gear shifter unit together and clamp it to the handle bar
A <GEAR TO COMPRESSOR COUPLING> is a <GEAR COUPLING> that is used to connect gear and compressor.
A <GEAR TRAIN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that consists of two or more gear wheels, for for transmitting motion from one shaft to the other
A <GEAR WHEEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that is a toothed wheel usend in conjunction with another, or with a rack, to transmit motion

A <GEARBOX> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSMITTER(force)> and that consistes of a gear casing with an arrangement of two or more gear-wheels transmitting rotating motion from the input shaft to the output shaft
A <GEARED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is driven via a gear
A <GENERATOR DRIVE GAS TURBINE> is a <GAS TURBINE> gas turbine that is used for power generation
A <GENERATOR SET> is a <GENERATOR> and a <SYSTEM> that is an assembly of rotating machines transforming mechanical or thermal energy into electricity

A <GEROTOR GEAR PUMP> is an <INTERNAL GEAR PUMP> utilizing one gear-rotor with internally cut gear teeth meshing with a gear rotor with externally cut gear to transport liquid without requiring a crescent shaped partition

A <GLAND> is  a <MACHINE COMPONENT> and a <SEAL> that prevents leakage of fluid along a rotating shaft or reciprocating rod passing through a boundary between areas of high and low pressure. It often consists of a flanged metal sleeve bedding into a stuffing box
A <GLAND BOLT> is a <BOLT> connecting a valve gland follower to a valve bonnet
A <GLAND CONDENSER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONDENSER> used to collect steam leaking from turbine shaft end labyringths and condensing that back to DM water.
A <GLAND NUT> is a <NUT> connecting to the valve gland bolt to fasten a valve gland follower to a valve bonnet
A <GREASE LUBRICATED BEARING> is a <LUBRICATED BEARING> that is provided with grease.
A <GREASE LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> intended to lubricate rotating or moving items with grease

A <GREASE NIPPLE> is a <NOZZLE> provided with a miniature, spring loaded non return valve which is connected vian a pipe or passage to a greased bearing. The nipple outer shape can lock into a grease pump (gun) nozzle and facilitate the high pressure pumping of grease into the bearing
A <GREASE-LUBRICATED GEAR COUPLING> is a <GEAR COUPLING> which is lubricated by grease.
A <GRINDING ELEMENT> is a functional <COMPONENT> of a <GRINDER>
A <GRIT PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <GRIT>

A <GROUT INJECTION SYSTEM> is an <INJECTION SYSTEM> that includes injection of grout to fill up hollow space. The grout when hardened obtain contact between elements and increase combined strength. Used for instance to secure piles in a jacket

A <GUIDE BLADE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GUIDE> that is (are) (a) metal blade(s), located in a duct, in order to make the air or gas to change direction around a bend or before a turbine blade etc., with a minimum of pressure loss
A <GUIDE BLADE CARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is the stationary part inside the casing containing the stator blades
A <GUIDE BUSHING> is a <BUSHING> and a <GUIDE> that is plain and intended to guide a line shaft in a vertical suspended pump. It can be located in a pump column and/or in a bowl
A <GUIDE BUSHING - BOWL AND COLUMN> is a <GUIDE BUSHING> which is plain and is intended to guide a line shaft in a vertical suspended pump. It can be located in a pump column and/or in a bowl
A <GUIDE FUNNEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GUIDE> that is a tapered enlargement at the end of a guidance member to for initial guidance over another guidance member
A <GUIDE VANE> is a <VANE> and a <GUIDE> that is made oF foil intended to guide a gas flow. Typically in a coalescer

SuperClass: ARTEFACT, ATMOSPHERIC OPEN FLUID CONTAINER, TRAP
TextDefinition: A <GUMBO TRAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ATMOSPHERIC OPEN FLUID CONTAINER> and a <TRAP> for taking care of the heavy, sticky mud formed downhole by certain shales when they become wet from the drilling fluid
A <HAND PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is operated by hand
