A <HANDWHEEL OPERATED GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is driven by a hand wheel, typically a worm gear
A <HANGER BEARING> is a <BEARING ASSEMBLY> that consists of a bearing mounted in a hanger.

A <HARMONIC DRIVE> is a <GEAR> that has a rigid circular ring with teeth on the inside and a flex spline and wave generator that are placed inside the circular spline, meshing the teeth of the flex spline and the circular spline. The rotation action of the wave generator results in a much slower rotation of the flex spline in the opposite direction.

UniqueName: HEAT EXCHANGER COLD SIDE FLUID INLET PORT
TextDefinition: A <HEAT EXCHANGER COLD SIDE FLUID INLET PORT > is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID INLET PORT > at the cold side of a <HEAT EXCHANGER>

UniqueName: HEAT EXCHANGER COLD SIDE FLUID OUTLET PORT
TextDefinition: A <HEAT EXCHANGER COLD SIDE FLUID OUTLET PORT > is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID OUTLET PORT > at the cold side of a <HEAT EXCHANGER>
A <HEAT EXCHANGER COLD SIDE INLET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID INLET PORT> that allows for entry of a fluid into a <HEAT EXCHANGER COLD SIDE COMPARTMENT>
A <HEAT EXCHANGER COLD SIDE OUTLET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> that is a part of a <HEAT EXCHANGER COLD SIDE COMPARTMENT>

UniqueName: HEAT EXCHANGER HOT SIDE FLUID INLET PORT
TextDefinition: A <HEAT EXCHANGER HOT SIDE FLUID INLET PORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID INLET PORT> at the hot side of a <HEAT EXCHANGER>

UniqueName: HEAT EXCHANGER HOT SIDE FLUID OUTLET PORT
TextDefinition: A <HEAT EXCHANGER HOT SIDE FLUID OUTLET PORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> at the hot side of a <HEAT EXCHANGER>
A <HEAT EXCHANGER HOT SIDE INLET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID INLET PORT> that allows for entry of a fluid into a <HEAT EXCHANGER HOT SIDE COMPARTMENT>
A <HEAT EXCHANGER HOT SIDE OUTLET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> that allows for exit of a fluid from a <HEAT EXCHANGER HOT SIDE COMPARTMENT>

A <HEAT RECOVERY DIESEL ENGINE> is a <DIESEL ENGINE> by which a significant amount of the thermal energy from the exhaust is applied for any combined heat and/or power application in order to achieve an overall inreased efficiency of the total installation
A <HEATING CIRCULATING PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <CIRCULATING> hot fluid to provide heating
A <HEATING/COOLING JACKET> is a <HEATING JACKET> and a <COOLING JACKET>
A <HEAVY DUTY LIPSEAL> is a <LIPSEAL> that is intended to withstand medium pressure.
A <HEAVY OIL DIESEL ENGINE> is a <DIESEL ENGINE> designed to run on heavy oil.
A <HELICAL GEAR> is a <GEAR> that is utilizing slanting teeth.
A <HELICAL GEARBOX> is a <PARALLEL SHAFT GEARBOX> that contains gear wheels with slanting teeth.
A <HELICAL MIXER IMPELLER> is an <AXIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER> that contains a specially curved spiral-shaped blade intended to mix high viscous liquids.

A <HELICAL ROTOR PUMP> is a <ROTARY PUMP> that consists of a helical rotor and a twin helix, twice the wavelength and double the diameter helical hole in a rubber stator. The rotor seals tightly against the rubber stator as it rotates, forming a set of fixed-size cavities in between. The cavities move when the rotor is rotated but their shape or volume does not change. The pumped material is moved inside the cavities.

UniqueName: HIGH SPEED INTEGRALLY GEARED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
TextDefinition: A <HIGH SPEED INTEGRALLY GEARED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is provided with a speed increasing gear box integral with the pump. The impeller is mounted directly to the gear box output shaft. It is provided with self contained lubrication system .
A <HIGH SPEED SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is the shaft with the highest speed. Typically related to equipment with more than one shaft.
A <HIGH-SPEED DIESEL ENGINE> is a <DIESEL ENGINE> with a relatively high rotational speed, i.e above 600 rpm.
A <HONEYCOMB STATIC LABYRINTH SEAL> is a <STATIC LABYRINTH SEAL> that has a honeycomb clearance surface
A <HOOD> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> that is intended for a covering, capping, or protection, or resembling a hood in shape or use
A <HORIZONTAL PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> where the pump shaft is horizontally oriented
A <HORIZONTAL SPLIT CASING CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> that has a horizontally split casing at the midsection and the top. The bottom halves are bolted and doweled together.
A <HOT OIL PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <OIL> at a high temperature

An <HP HYDRAULIC FLUID SUPPLY LINE> is a <HYDRAULIC FLUID LINE> intended for transport of high pressure hydraulic pressure fluid, i.e. 690 bar, to a surface controlled sub surface safety valve (SCSSV)
A <HUB> is an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> that is the central part of a rotating piece of equipment which is bored out to receive the shaft
An <HVAC AIR INLET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS INLET PORT> for intake of air into a <HVAC SYSTEM>
An <HVAC AIR OUTLET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS OUTLET PORT> for outlet of air from a HVAC system
An <HVAC DUCT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DUCT> that is a large sheet metal duct or casing through which air is passed for forced-draught, ventilation or air-conditioning purposes
An <HVAC GRILLE> is an <ARTEFACTE> and a <GAS PORT> of metal bars or wire for delivering supply air to a room or for collecting extract air from a room

A <HYDRAULIC CHARGE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is a fixed/positive displacement pump (normally a gear type) that charges or feeds a hydrostatic pump loop. It is normally an integral part of the transmission but can be a standalone or piggyback pump off a through drive. It makes up for  internal leakages from a transmission and motor, and it will also maintain a constant back pressure that is required from most (if not all) hydrostatic pump/motor manufacturers
A <HYDRAULIC CONNECTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> for releasably connecting hydraulic fluid lines, having means for closing the fluid path when the connector is released
A <HYDRAULIC CYLINDER> is a <MECHANICAL CYLINDER> where the piston is actuated by pressurized hydraulic fluid.
A <HYDRAULIC DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VIBRATION DAMPER> that is employing hydraulic oil confined in a cylinder to decrease the amplitude of mechanical oscillations
A <HYDRAULIC IMPULSE TURBINE> is a <IMPULSE TURBINE> in which a liquid acts chiefly by its kinetic energy

SuperClass: ARTEFACT, HYDRAULIC TO ROTATION ENERGY CONVERTER, MOTOR
TextDefinition: A <HYDRAULIC MOTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <MOTOR> and a <HYDRAULIC TO ROTATION ENERGY CONVERTER> that is intended to generate power by means of high pressure oil

A <HYDRAULIC POWER RECOVERY TURBINE>, also referred to as HPRT, is a <HYDRAULIC TURBINE> that is used in a process when a fluid is pressurized and must be reduced in pressure. Rather than throttle the fluid pressure though a pressure reducing valve (PRV) and waste the stored energy, a PRT can be used to drop the fluid pressure and turn the turbine impeller and drive a generator or drive shaft to another process.

A <HYDRAULIC POWER UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HYDRAULIC POWER SUPPLY> and that is a unit that is, as a minimum, consisting of a engine driven hydraulic pump and a reservoir which is delivering hydraulic energy to one or more consumers

A <HYDRAULIC PUMP> is a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> used in hydraulic drive systems and can be hydrostatic or hydrodynamic. It is a mechanical source of power that converts mechanical power into hydraulic energy (hydrostatic energy i.e. flow, pressure). It generates flow with enough power to overcome pressure induced by the load at the pump outlet. When a hydraulic pump operates, creates a vacuum at the pump inlet, which forces liquid from the reservoir into the inlet line to the pump and by mechanical action delivers this liquid to the pump outlet and forces it into the hydraulic system.
A <HYDRAULIC REACTION TURBINE> is a <REACTION TURBINE> that converts the potential energy of a flowing liquid to rotational energy for further use
A <HYDRAULIC RECIPROCATING MOTOR> is a <HYDRAULIC MOTOR> that uses a reciprocating motion which usually is converted into rotary motion
A <HYDRAULIC ROTARY MOTOR> is a <HYDRAULIC MOTOR> that uses a vane-rotor or a gear-rotor to convert pressure energy into rotational energy
A <HYDRAULIC SHOCK ABSORBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHOCK ABSORBER> that uses a cylinder filled with a hydraulic fluid
A <HYDRAULIC SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <SWIVEL JOINT> that is used in a hydraulic system
A <HYDRAULIC TORQUE CONVERTER> is <FLUID COUPLING> allowing a smooth start of a driven equiment and then keeping a nearly constant speed
A <HYDRAULIC TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> is a <TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> where the turning mass is connected to the driver plate by means of hydraulic loaded friction linings
A <HYDRAULIC VARIABLE SPEED GEARBOX> is a <VARIABLE SPEED GEARBOX> that is hydraulically operated.

SuperClass: CONTROLLED VOLUME DIAPHRAGM PUMP, HYDRAULICALLY ACTUATED ARTEFACT
TextDefinition: A <HYDRAULICALLY ACTUATED DIAPHRAGM PUMP> is a <CONTROLLED VOLUME DIAPHRAGM PUMP> and a <HYDRAULICALLY ACTUATED ARTEFACT> where the diaphragm is hydraulically coupled to a piston or plunger. The piston or plunger is moving hydraulic liquid in and out of a chamber behind the diaphragm. The diaphragm separates hydraulic and pumped liquid
A <HYDROCYCLONE> is a <CYCLONE> and a <CYLINDRICAL VESSEL>, intended to separate a fluid by hydraulic forces

A <HYDROCYCLONE DEOILER> is a <HYDROCYCLONE> that is a small cyclone extractor for removing suspended matter from a flowing liquid or separating two fluids with different density by forcing the fluid to flow through a tight conical vortex

A <HYDRODYNAMIC BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that conforms to the hydrodynamic lubrication principle, which means that the bearing surfaces are oriented so that relative motion forms an oil wedge, to support the load without shaft-to-bearing contact

A <HYDRODYNAMIC DRIVE> is a <HYDRAULIC TORQUE CONVERTER> utilizing planetary gear trains acting as a oil pump. Throttling the discharge of these pumps creates back pressure and increases the drive torque to the sun gear
A <HYDRODYNAMIC RADIAL BEARING> is a <HYDRODYNAMIC BEARING> and a <RADIAL BEARING> that is designed to support a shaft or rotor in radial direction and to take up radial load

A <HYDRODYNAMIC THRUST BEARING> is a <HYDRODYNAMIC BEARING> and a <THRUST BEARING> that is designed to accommodate for any residual axial load within any rotating equipment design under all possible operating conditions

A <HYDROKINETIC DRIVE> is a <HYDRAULIC TORQUE CONVERTER> utilizing an oil fluid beeing accelerated in an impeller (driving member) and then decelerated as it impinge on the blades of the runner (driven member)
A <HYDROSTATIC DRIVE> is <FLUID COUPLING> that uses positive displacement hydraulic pumps in conjunction with positive displacement hydraulic motors

A <HYDROVISCOUS DRIVE> is a <HYDRAULIC TORQUE CONVERTER> utilizing the variation of shear forces in a oil film. The hydroviscous drive varies its torque capability by varying the film thickness between driving and driven members rotating in oil
A <HYPOID GEAR> is a <GEAR> that has cone shaped gears similar to spiral bevel gears except they transmit motion between non-intersecting shafts.
A <HYPOID GEARBOX> is a <CROSSED AXIS GEARBOX> where the input and output shafts are not intersecting utilizing a pinion and gear with hyperboloid cut gear teeth.
An <I-BEAM STRUCTURE> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> and a <SUPPORT> built from <I-BEAM>s
An <IDLER GEAR> is a <GEAR> rotor running free (not driven by timing gear).
An <IDLER SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that locates gears within a gear box, but does not transmit power.
An <IGNITION CHAMBER> is a <CHAMBER> that is intended to ignite a combustible mixture

An <IMPELLER> is a <MECHANICAL TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER> that is an assembly of rotating vanes within an enclosure which is used to impart energy to or derive energy from a fluid through dynamic force
An <IMPELLER ASSEMBLY> is an <IMPELLER> and a <SYSTEM> that is an assembly of parts belonging to the impeller and where the impeller is the main component
An <IMPELLER BACK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is located on the non inlet eye side of an impeller to form the back of the impeller. Typically for single entry centrifugal pump impeller

An <IMPELLER BACK WEAR RING> is a <WEAR RING> that is interchangeable and fitted to the impeller back side to reduce the quantity of liquid leaking from the high pressure side to the impeller back side and throat bushing if present. It serves as a wearable component
An <IMPELLER BETWEEN BEARINGS> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMPELLER> that is mounted on a shaft with the bearings at both ends
An <IMPELLER COLLET> is a <RING> that is intended to lock and secure an impeller from relative rotation to a shaft
An <IMPELLER EYE> is a <Feature> that is the impeller at the front off the vanes intended to enable fluid to enter the impeller
An <IMPELLER EYE LABYRINTH SEAL> is a <LABYRINTH SEAL> intended to minimize internal recirculation at impeller inlet
An <IMPELLER FRONT COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is the impeller front cover, as part of the impeller, located at the impeller suction side
An <IMPELLER FRONT WEAR RING> is a <WEAR RING> that is interchangeable and fitted to the impeller at suction side; it is a wearable part used to contain losses due to recirculation.
An <IMPELLER GASKET> is a <GASKET> that is intended for use between impeller hub and impeller nut to prevent leakage.
An <IMPELLER HUB> is a <HUB> that is the central part of the impeller which is bored out to receive the shaft.
An <IMPELLER KEY> is a <SHAFT KEY> that is intended for securing an impeller to the shaft
An <IMPELLER NUT> is a <NUT> that is intended to fasten an impeller on the shaft-end
An <IMPELLER SHROUD> is a <SHROUD> that is the part of the impeller front cover located at the outer diameter.
An <IMPELLER SUPPORT - BETWEEN BEARINGS> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT>  that supports the <IMPELLER> with a <BEARING> at both sides
An <IMPELLER SUPPORT - OVERHUNG> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that supports the <IMPELLER> with a <BEARING> at shaft side only; a cantilever design
An <IMPELLER VANE> is a <VANE> that guides the fluid through an impeller during pumping or compression.
An <IMPELLER WEAR RING> is a <WEAR RING> fitted to an impeller to reduce the quantity of liquid leaking from the high pressure side to the suction side.

An <IMPULSE STEAM TURBINE> is a <STEAM TURBINE> and an <IMPULSE TURBINE> that contains nozzles intended to act as high-speed jets and impulse blading. The pressure drops takes only place by expanding steam across the nozzle vanes

An <IMPULSE TURBINE> is  a <TURBINE> that contains a high pressure impulse wheel, followed by intermediate and low pressure reaction blading, mounted on a drum-shaped rotor, in which a fluid drives the wheel chiefly by its kinetic energy; there is no pressure drop in the blading , only in the nozzles.
An <INBOARD BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is located closest to the center of the equipment. Typically the process side in case of pumps and compressors
An <INBOARD DISTANCE PIECE> is a <DISTANCE PIECE> that is located at the frame end of the equipment.
An <INDIRECT ACTING PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> in which the displacing element is driven by means of a beam or linkage connected to a separate reciprocating engine.

An <INDIRECT INJECTION DIESEL ENGINE> is a <DIESEL ENGINE> that is of the indirect injection type by which fuel is injected into a pre-combustion chamber that is connected to the cylinder by a narrow passage
An <INDIVIDUALLY SECURED PUMP IMPELLER> is a <PUMP IMPELLER> of a multistage pump which is locked against axial movement, related to the shaft, in oposite direction to normal hydraulic thrust.

An <INDUCER TYPE PUMP IMPELLER> is an <AXIAL FLOW PUMP IMPELLER> with one or a few screw type blades which are placed in front of a conventional impeller, on the same shaft, to reduce the <NPSH> requirement of the pump.
An <INDUSTRIAL BUILDING> is a <BUILDING(structure)> used for industrial activities
An <INDUSTRIAL GAS TURBINE> is a <GAS TURBINE> that is intended for application in the field of mechanical drive or generator drive and is positioned in a ground-based fixed location
An <INDUSTRIAL TYPE GAS TURBINE> is a <GAS TURBINE> that is intended for application in the field of mechanical drive or generator drive and is positioned in a ground-based fixed location
An <INERGEN SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> containing the units required for operating an inergen system
An <INJECTION PUMP> is a < POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> that is typically applied for relatively high pressures in case of injection systems
An <INJECTION SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that injects a substance into a location
An <INLET VANE> is a <VANE> that is located at an inlet and is intended to direct fluid flow.

An <IN-LINE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the pump suction and discharge connections have a common center line intercepting with the shaft axis; the piping need not be dismantled for removing the pump internals
An <IN-LINE ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> with an engine block where the cylinders are standing in a line.
An <IN-LINE ENGINE CYLINDER BLOCK> is a <PISTON ENGINE BLOCK> where the cylinders are standing in a line.

An <IN-LINE MOUNTED CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> where the inlet and outlet flanges are supporting the pump by connecting them to the piping system and having a common centreline that intersects the shaft axis.
An <INNER CASING> is a  <CASING> that is mounted inside a barrel or outer casing and in which pumping or compression takes place and that is subject to the discharge pressure at its outside

An <INNER MAGNET RING> is a <MACHINE COMPONENT> that is a rotor ring containing magnets close coupled to the impeller in a magnetically driven pump, driven by the outer magnet ring coupled to the electric motor
An <INPUT SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is the entrance of mechanical energy and driven by an external energy source.
A <INTEGRAL SHAFT FLANGE COUPLING HUB> is a <COUPLING HUB> which is integral to the shaft and is not keyed or shrink fitted
A <INTEGRAL THRUST COLLAR> is a <THRUST COLLAR> that is integral with a <SHAFT>

An <INTEGRALLY GEARED CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> is a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR> that contains one bull gear which is driving several pinions including shafts and impellers to achieve multistage compression
An <INTEGRALLY GEARED STEAM TURBINE> is a <STEAM TURBINE> that
An <INTERMEDIATE BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is located between the inboard and outboard bearing
An <INTERMEDIATE BEARING SPIDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is intended to serve as support structure for an intermediate bearing
An <INTERMEDIATE GEAR SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that has gears by which subject shaft is neither the input nor the output shaft.
An <INTERMEDIATE PARTITION PACKING> is a <PACKING(seal)> that is located at the partition between the inboard- and outboard distance piece to prevent gas leakage into the inboard distance piece
An <INTERMEDIATE SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is between other shafts intended to be connected to each other in order to form one common shaft.
An <INTERMEDIATE SHAFT SLEEVE> is a <SHAFT SLEEVE> that is located on an intermediate shaft.
An <INTERNAL CIRCUMFERENTIAL PISTON PUMP> is a <CIRCUMFERENTIAL PISTON PUMP> in which each rotor has two or more piston elements. Timing gear is not required
An <INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE> is a <COMBUSTION ENGINE> where the combustion takes place inside the engine cylinder.

An <INTERNAL GEAR PUMP> is a <GEAR PUMP> that contains one gear-rotor with internally cut gear teeth meshing with a gear rotor with externally cut gear to transport liquid from suction to discharge port with or without a crescent shaped partition.
An <INTERNAL GEAR PUMP WITH CRESCENT> is an <INTERNAL GEAR PUMP> which contains a crescent shaped partition
An <INTERNAL GEAR PUMP WITHOUT CRESCENT> is an <INTERNAL GEAR PUMP> that does not contain a crescent shaped partition
An <INTERNAL THRUST BEARING> is a <THRUST BEARING> built into an engine to take the propeller thrust forces.
An <INTERSTAGE BUSHING> is a <BUSHING> that is located between the inboard and outboard bushing on a rotor.
An <INTERSTAGE DIAPHRAGM> is a <DIAPHRAGM> intended to separate flow between two <STAGE>s in case of a <CENTRIFUGAL COMPRESSOR >
An <INTERSTAGE SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is applicable as seal or sealing element between two stages
An <INTERSTAGE SHAFT SLEEVE> is a <SHAFT SLEEVE> that is located on a shaft between two impeller stages.
An <INVOLUTE GEAR PUMP> is an <INTERNAL GEAR PUMP> utilizing one gear-rotor with internally cut gear teeth meshing with a gear rotor with externally cut gear with a crescent shaped partition

An <ISO-CARBON SEAL> is a <COMPRESSOR OR EXPANDER SEAL> that is a mechanical contact shaft seal with stationary carbon ring in order to separate oil and gas during operation and stand-still condition.
An <ISO-SLEEVE SEAL> is a <COMPRESSOR OR EXPANDER SEAL> that is provided with sealing rings or bushings and labyrinths and operating with a sealing liquid in order to prevent gas leakage.

A <JET ENGINE> is a <REACTION TURBINE> that generates thrust by jet propulsion. This includes airbreathing jet engines (turbojets, turbofans, ramjets, and pulse jets) and non-airbreathing jet engines (such as rocket engines)
A <JET WATER PUMP SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> containing the pump system for water jet

A <JETTY> is a solid <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> built out into the sea or along the shore as a part of a port (sometimes as two arms encircling it) alongside which ships (specially tankers) can lie. Often used as a synonym for pier
A <KAPLAN TURBINE> is an <AXIAL HYDRAULIC REACTION TURBINE> that is provided with adjustable runner blades and operates at relatively high flow rates
A <KELLY WIPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WIPER> that is a kelly attachment intended to clean the kelly
A <KEY WAY> is a <Feature> that is a longitudinal slot cut into a shaft or hub to receive a shaft key
A <LABYRINTH COMPRESSOR> is a <PISTON COMPRESSOR> where the piston is provided with labyrinths instead of piston- and rider rings.

A <LABYRINTH SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is a non-contacting circumferential seal utilizing a tortured path for flow between tha stationary and rotating parts. The design utilizes a series of pressure drops to reduce the leakage
A <LABYRINTH SEPARATION SEAL> is a <SEPARATION SEAL> that uses soft material labyrinths for sealing
A <LABYRINTH SHAFT SEAL> is a <SHAFT SEAL> that is castelated to create long leakage paths with low flow area, over a short section of a shaft.

UniqueName: LABYRINTH TYPE BEARING HOUSING END SEAL
TextDefinition: A <LABYRINTH TYPE BEARING HOUSING END SEAL> is a <LABYRINTH SEAL> that is a bearing housing end seal that uses a labyrinth for sealing

A <LANTERN RING> is a <RING> made out of metallic or synthetic material that forms a chamber between upper and lower sets of compression pacings in a stuffing box. A port from the bonnet connected with the lantern ring may have several functions: f.i. an injection chamber for a gland seal
A <LAVAL TURBINE> is an <IMPULSE STEAM TURBINE> that is provided with one pressure stage and one velocity stage
A <LEVELING PLATE> is a <SUPPORT> and a <PLATE> located underneath a jackscrew in order to allow leveling of a base plate

A <LIFETIME PRELUBRICATED BEARING> is a <GREASE LUBRICATED BEARING> that contains shields or seals at both sides by which the grease doesn't need to be refilled at all during the lifetime of the bearing.
A <LIFT PUMP is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> a liquid from one level to a higher level
A <LIFTING MACHINE> is a <MACHINE> and a <LIFTING DEVICE> intended to lift and move heavy equipment
A <LIGHT DUTY LIPSEAL> is a <LIPSEAL> for low pressure applications.
A <LIME SLURRY PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <LIME SLURRY>
A <LINE SHAFT> is a <PUMP SHAFT> that is intended to transmit power from a dry mounted motor on top of a (long) vertical suspended pump to a submerged impeller.

A <LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <VERTICAL SUSPENDED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that vertical suspended centrifugal pump that contains a long shaft intended to transmit power from the dry mounted motor on top of the pump to the submerged pump impeller. The line shaft is typically supported by bearings inside the pump column and can be either of the open or enclosed type

SuperClass: ARTEFACT, CHEMICAL TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER
TextDefinition: A <LINEAR CONVERTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CHEMICAL TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER> that is a facility to convert internal chemical energy from a fluid into mechanical energy by controlled combustion in a linear engine (i.e. the Otto process)
A <LINED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is containing liquid exposed parts provided with a liner material to make the pump resistant for slurries
A <LIPSEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> that is an elastomeric or metallic closure which reduces leakage by a scraping or wiping action at a controlled interference between itself and the rotating part.
A <LIQUID GAS PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <LIQUIFIED GAS>
A <LIQUID INLET PORT> is a <FLUID INLET PORT> and a <LIQUID PORT> that allows for entry of a <LIQUID COMPOUND>
A <LIQUID LUBRICATED MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> by which the sealing medium is a liquid that forms a thin liquid film between the seal faces intended to prevent heat of friction.
A <LIQUID OUTLET PORT> is a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> and a <LIQUID PORT> that allows for exit of a <LIQUID COMPOUND>
A <LIQUID PORT> is a <FLUID PORT> intended for liquid

A <LIQUID RING COMPRESSOR> is a <ROTARY COMPRESSOR> intended to use a liquid annulus held by centrifugal force around the inside of a casing by a single rotor-impeller to compress vapour isothermically.
A <LIQUID RING PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is consisting of a casing and an eccentric impeller intended for pumping liquids often mixed with vapour
A <LIQUID SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that uses a liquid slot or film for sealing
A <LIVING QUARTER STRUCTURE> is a <MODULE STRUCTURE> that is a structural facility of the living quarter.
A <LJUNGSTROM TURBINE> is a <STEAM TURBINE> that is of the radial double-rotation design in which the blading is mounted on two wheels running in opposite direction
A <LOBE PUMP> is a <ROTARY PUMP> intended to carry a liquid in cavities within a chamber, between meshed and timed rotor lobe surfaces, from the inlet to the outlet.

A <LOGIC CAP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DISTRIBUTOR> for hydraulic and chemical <FLUID>s, which provide the ability to redirect services by replacing an outboard <MQC PLATE> with an <ROV>. Logic caps provide the flexibility to modify distribution of hydraulic or chemical services due to circuit failures or changes in system requirements. A logic cap consists of a stab plate mounted hydraulic couplers connected to HFL (Hydraulic Fluid Line) tubing and plumbed accordingly to suit the application
A <LOW SPEED SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that has the lowest speed related to equipment trains with more than one shaft.
A <LOWER HALF CASING> is a <CASING> that is a section of a compressor or turbine casing being the bottom half in order to receive the rotor and auxiliaries and to support the lower half diaphragms.
A <LOW-SPEED DIESEL ENGINE> is a <DIESEL ENGINE> with a relatively low rotational speed, i.e less than 360 rpm.
A <LUBE OIL OUTLET> is a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> intended to drain lube oil
A <LUBRICATED BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> where the presence of a lubricant is required
A <LUBRICATION OIL HEATER> is an <OIL HEATER> intended to increase or maintain lube oil temperature in an oil reservoir
A <LUBRICATION OIL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> and an <OIL SYSTEM> that supplies lube oil to moving parts of a machine
A <LUBRICATION PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PRESSURISING> a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM>
A <LUBRICATION RING> is a <RING> that is a loose metal ring, rotating with shaft and dipping into oil to lift lubricant up to an area requiring lubrication
A <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> that is intended to provide lubrication to motion parts of equipment involved
A <LUBRICATOR> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <LUBRICATING>
A <LUBRICATOR SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a  <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> that is a fresh lubricant supply system which provides lubrication to stuffing box and/or cylinder(s) of equipment involved
A <LUFFING MOTOR> is a <MOTOR> that is intended to alter the inclination of something
A <MACHINE COMPONENT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPONENT> that is part of an <MACHINE>
A <MAGNETIC BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is an electromagnetic device which maintains the relative position of a rotating assembly (rotor) with respect to the stationary part

A <MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <SEALLESS CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the driven shaft and impeller are completely contained in a pressurized containment and the power required is transmitted through the containment barrier by magnetic force created by permanent magnets or by an induction device.

UniqueName: MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP EXTERNAL MAGNET SHROUD
TextDefinition: A <MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP EXTERNAL MAGNET SHROUD> is a <SHROUD> that provides a cover that contains the external magnet of a magnetic drive centrifugal pump

UniqueName: MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP INTERNAL MAGNET SHROUD
TextDefinition: A <MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP INTERNAL MAGNET SHROUD> is a <SHROUD> that provides a cover that contains the internal magnet and part of the inner rotor of a magnetic drive centrifugal pump

UniqueName: MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP SPACER CAN
TextDefinition: A <MAGNETIC DRIVE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP SPACER CAN> is a <SPACER CAN> that is the separation part between the internal rotor and the external driven rotor of a magnet drive centrifugal pump
A <MAGNETIC DRIVE ROTARY PUMP> is a <ROTARY PUMP> that uses a coupling by magnetic force to transmit torque from a driver to a sealless rotary pump.
A <MAGNETIC FRICTION CLUTCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLUTCH> utilizing the friction of electromagnetic force in combination with friction to connect or disconnect two shafts or rotating members
A <MAGNETICALLY COUPLED PUMP> is a <SEALLESS CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the driver is coupled to the pump by a drive magnet that eliminates any shaft sealing required by the pump
A <MAINTENANCE SHOP> is a <BUILDING(structure)> in which maintanance activities take place
A <MANUAL BALANCING DAMPER> is a <BALANCING DAMPER> that is operated manually
A <MARINE DIESEL ENGINE> is a <DIESEL ENGINE> designed for marine environment.
A <MARINE PUMP>  is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <WITHSTANDING> offshore conditions

A <MARINE SCREW PROPELLER> is a <PROPELLER> that is carrying 2, 3 or 4 blades of helical form, which produces the thrust to drive a ship by giving momentum to the column of water which it displaces in an astern direction.

A <MARINE TYPE IMPELLER> is an <AXIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER> that is provided with constant pitch, skewed-back blades as three(3) blade propeller in order to perform down-pumping actions to tank bottom in mixing liquids.

A <MATING RING> is a <RING> that is a ring-shaped part of a mechanical seal, mounted either on a shaft sleeve or in a housing, which provides the primary seal when in proximity to the face of an axially adjustable primary ring seal face
An <MDO DIESEL ENGINE> is a <DIESEL ENGINE> designed to run on medium heavy diesel oil.

A <MECHANICAL ADJUSTABLE SPEED DRIVE> is a <VARIABLE TRANSMISSION> that is intended to convert a constant rotational input speed to a rotational output speed that is steplessly variable within a certain range by mechanical means
A <MECHANICAL BRAKE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BRAKE> in which the braking force is provided by friction between brake blocks or pads and the wheels or separate discs
A <MECHANICAL CLUTCH> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CLUTCH> intended to use spring force or hydraulic force in combination with friction to connect or disconnect two shafts or rotating members

A <MECHANICAL CONTACT COUPLING> is a <FLEXIBLE COUPLING> designed to transmit torqe by direct mechanical contact between mating parts and accommodate misalignment and axial displacement by relative rocking and sliding motion between the parts in contact. The contacting parts may be metallic or may be made of self-lubricating non-metallic material.
A <MECHANICAL CONTACT SEAL> is a <COMPRESSOR OR EXPANDER SEAL> that is provided with labyrinths and slingers and pressurized oil-injection to the rotating seal faces.
A <MECHANICAL CYLINDER> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is a tubular chamber in which a piston of an engine, pump, compressor or actuator reciprocates in order to make compression or expansion happen.
A <MECHANICAL DRIVE GAS TURBINE> is a <GAS TURBINE> that is used to provide mechanical energy as opposed to driving a generator of electrical power
A <MECHANICAL OSCILLATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <OSCILLATOR> that is an apparatus for generating oscillatory currents by mechanical means

A <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COUPLER> and an <ENERGY TRANSFERRER> that is a flexible or rigid connection between two coaxial shafts, transferring torque from the one to the other

A <MECHANICAL SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that comprises of a set of one or more rotating and stationary seal faces, together with auxiliary hardware, separated by a film of fluid intended to reduce flow loss around a rotating shaft to an acceptable level

UniqueName: MECHANICAL SEAL AUTOMATIC REFILLING LUBRICATION SYSTEM
SuperClass: MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM
TextDefinition: A <MECHANICAL SEAL AUTOMATIC REFILLING LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> where the buffer fluid is circulated and cooled in a loop outside the fluid tank. The pressurisation and leakage compensation is taken care of by an electric or pneumatic driven pump with pressure control valve for manual regulation of buffer fluid pressure. Should the pump be swithed off, the pressure will be maintained for a limited time by an accumulator.

UniqueName: MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM
TextDefinition: A <MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> where all components are kept under the same pressure. The pressure is applied by means of nitrogen, by the process medium pressure or via a refill system.

UniqueName: MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED LOOP LUBRICATION SYSTEM
SuperClass: MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM
TextDefinition: A <MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED LOOP LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> where the buffer fluid is circulated through a cooler by a pumping ring in the seal chamber. Possible leakage compensation is taken care of by manual refilling.

UniqueName: MECHANICAL SEAL DEAD END LUBRICATION SYSTEM
SuperClass: MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM
TextDefinition: A <MECHANICAL SEAL DEAD END LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> where the buffer fluid is supplied to the seal chamber inlet only. The seal chamber outlet is plugged.

UniqueName: MECHANICAL SEAL EXTERNAL SOURCE LUBRICATION SYSTEM
SuperClass: MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM
TextDefinition: A <MECHANICAL SEAL EXTERNAL SOURCE LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> where clean buffer fluid is circulated through the seal chamber by an external source. The buffer fluid pressure is greater than the process fluid pressure. Typically it can be water from the freshwater supply system.
A <MECHANICAL SEAL GAS LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL LUBRICATION SYSTEM> providing gas (N2 or air) to dry gas seals (DGS) arrangements.
A <MECHANICAL SEAL LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL LUBRICATION SYSTEM> providing buffer fluid to a pressurized dual arrangements.
A <MECHANICAL SEAL LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> which provides lubrication and/or buffer fluid to a mechanical seal arrangement

UniqueName: MECHANICAL SEAL OPEN CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM
TextDefinition: A <MECHANICAL SEAL OPEN CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> where the circulation and pressurization take place through a single buffer fluid system. After each circuit the buffer fluid is relieved and collected in a pressureless tank.

UniqueName: MECHANICAL SEAL PRESSURE BOOSTER LUBRICATION SYSTEM
SuperClass: MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM
TextDefinition: A <MECHANICAL SEAL PRESSURE BOOSTER LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> where the buffer fluid flows via a rising pipe into a vessel where it is cooled. The vessel is pressurized by means of a piston activated by the process medium pressure. This system is often used for double and tandem mechanical seal applications.
A <MECHANICAL SEAL PRODUCT LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL LUBRICATION SYSTEM> providing product lubrication to single mechanical seal arrangements.

UniqueName: MECHANICAL SEAL QUENCH FLUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM
SuperClass: MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM
TextDefinition: A <MECHANICAL SEAL QUENCH FLUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> acting as a reservoir, supplying single or tandem mechanical seals. The exchange of fluid takes place by thermosiphon principle or by forced circulation e.g. with a pumping ring.

SuperClass: MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM
TextDefinition: A <MECHANICAL SEAL THERMOSIPHON LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL CLOSED CIRCUIT LIQUID LUBRICATION SYSTEM> where the buffer fluid flows via a rising pipe into a vessel where it is cooled. The vessel is pressurized with air or nitrogen. This system is often used for double and tandem mechanical seal applications.
A <MECHANICALLY ACTUATED DIAPHRAGM PUMP> is a <CONTROLLED VOLUME DIAPHRAGM PUMP> where the diaphragm is mechanically coupled to a "piston" rod. The number of diaphragms and pump heads can be varied
A <MEDIUM-SPEED DIESEL ENGINE> is a <DIESEL ENGINE> with a medium rotational speed, i.e between 360 and 600 rpm.
A <MELT PUMP> is a <GEAR PUMP> that is designed for use a wide range of applications from PET sheet and rubber extrusion to recycling and compounding
A <METAL BELLOW SEAL> is a <BELLOW MECHANICAL SEAL> that utilizes metal bellows to provide loading and expansion at the seal faces and secondary sealing i.s.o. springs and an <O-ring>
A <METAL FAN is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> that is made of metal

A <METALLIC DIAPHRAGM COUPLING> is a <METALLIC FLEXIBLE ELEMENT COUPLING> consisting of one or more metallic flexible elements in the form of thin circular plates that are attached to one part of the coupling at their outer diameter and the other part at their inner diameter.

A <METALLIC DISC COUPLING> is a <METALLIC FLEXIBLE ELEMENT COUPLING> consisting of one or more metallic flexible elements that are alternately attached to the two parts of the coupling; the attachment points being substantially at the same distance from the centerline.
A <METALLIC FLEXIBLE ELEMENT COUPLING> is a <FLEXIBLE COUPLING> that obtains its flexibility from the flexing of thin metallic discs, diaphragms or links.
A <METHANOL INJECTION SYSTEM> is a <CHEMICAL INJECTION SYSTEM> that includes services for methanol storage, pumping and distribution both topside and subsea.
A <MID-WATER ARCH> is a <SUBSEA STRUCTURE> used to support and restrain flexible risers
A <MILLED IMPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMPELLER> that is milled
A <MIST LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> intended to provide lubrication by creating a mist of lubrication liquid to reach items that need lubrication
A <MIST OIL SYSTEM> is a <MIST LUBRICATION SYSTEM> and an <OIL SYSTEM> intended to provide lubrication by creating a mist of oil to reach items that need lubrication
A <MIXED FLOW COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> provided with an open impeller and an axial gas inlet and a radial outlet
A <MIXED FLOW PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that uses a mixed flow pump impeller.

A <MIXED FLOW PUMP IMPELLER> is a <PUMP IMPELLER> where the shape of the impeller includes for specific speed values in between of those for radial and axial flow type impellers, resulting in a combined axial and radial flow.

UniqueName: MIXED PRESSURE BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE
TextDefinition: A <MIXED PRESSURE BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE> is a <BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE> where steam enters the turbine at two or more pressures through separate inlet openings with means to control the inlet flows

A <MIXED PRESSURE CONDENSING STEAM TURBINE> is a <CONDENSING STEAM TURBINE> where steam enters the turbine at two or more pressures through separate inlet openings with means to control the inlet flows
A <MIXER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has a capability of <MIXING>

A <MIXER IMPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMPELLER> that is intended for use to impart energy to a fluid through centrifugal and axial force in order to perform flow, head and shear required for a mixing process
A <MIXING CONE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> and a <MIXER> of conical shape being a part of a planetary screw mixer, designed for mixing solids
A <MIXING TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that is used for mixing
A <MODULE STRUCTURE> is a <STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK> and a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> used to support the equipment in a module.
A <MOLASSES PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <MOLASSE>
A <MOTOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DRIVER(function)> that is powered by electricity or internal combustion
A <MOTOR CASING> is a  <CASING> that houses the stator part and the internals
A <MOTOR CASING COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is an intermediate part attached to the motor casing
A <MOTOR SLIDE RAIL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> on which an electric motor is mounted and serves as a tensioning device when a v-belt drive is involved
A <MOUNTING FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> that is used to attach a piece of equipment to a supporting item
A <MUD LUBRICATED BEARING> is a <LUBRICATED BEARING> used in drill bits which is lubricated using drilling mud.
A <MUD PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <MUD>

A <MULTILOBE BEARING> is a <HYDRODYNAMIC BEARING> with a non-cylindrical bearing bore and with two or more lobes. The lobe radius is larger than the shaft radius by a specific amount. This difference in the radius of the shaft and the lobe results in the formation of a wedge gap in each arc

A <MULTIPLE QUICK CONNECTS (MQC PLATE)> is a <HYDRAULIC CONNECTOR> that is outfitted with the appropriate number of couplers to match the number of tubes in the hydraulic flying leads. Any unused positions in the MQC plate are outfitted with blanked-off couplers. All tubes and coupling assignments need to match the tree assignments. All couplers are energized, and the <MQC PLATE> is capable of withstanding full coupler pressures (design pressure and test pressure)

A <MULTIPLE SPRING MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> where the mating ring is pushed against the primary ring by the force of a number of coil springs placed about the circumference of the shaft.
A <MULTIPLE VOLUTE> is a <VOLUTE> with more than two opposite located spiral channels to the discharge

A <MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> in which the head is developed by two ore more impellers operating in series, each taking its suction from the discharge of the preceding impeller
A <MULTISTAGE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> in which the head is developed by two or more stages, depending on the pump design, each taking its suction from the discharge of the preceding stage

A <MULTISTAGE RING SECTION PUMP> is a <MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is constructed with a number of cylindrical casing sections, one for each stage, which are stacked along the length of the shaft and sandwiched between two end pieces. The impellers all face in the same direction so that the flow of fluid through the pump is very simple 'in' at one end, 'out' the other
A <NATURAL AIR ASPIRATOR> is an <ENGINE ASPIRATOR> used to supply intake air to an engine at the atmospheric pressure.

SuperClass: AIR MANIFOLD, ENGINE ASPIRATOR, NATURAL AIR ASPIRATOR
TextDefinition: A <NATURAL AIR INLET MANIFOLD> is an <AIR MANIFOLD> and an <ENGINE ASPIRATOR> and a <NATURAL AIR ASPIRATOR> to supply intake air to an engine at atmospheric pressure
A <NATURAL ASPIRATED ENGINE> is a <PISTON ENGINE> which has natural aspiration, i.e. not equipped with turbocharger.
A <NATURAL DRAFT FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> intended to provide enhanced flow of air and is turned by wind
A <NATURAL GAS COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> designed for increasing the pressure of natural gas
An <NEAR CENTRE-LINE MOUNTED CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> with a minor distance between the centerline of the shaft/impeller and the suction flange centerline.
A <NEAR CENTRE-LINE MOUNTED PUMP CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> with a minor distance between the centerline of the shaft/impeller and the suction flange centerline
A <NEEDLE ROLLER BEARING> is a <ROLLER BEARING> that contains cylindrical rollers which have a small diameter and are long relative to their diameter.

A <NEEDLE ROLLER THRUST BEARING> is a <ROLLER BEARING> that consists of a needle roller and thrust cage located between a shaft washer and a housing washer to accommodate axial loads in one direction.

A <NINE STAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> in which the head is developed by nine impellers operating in series (each taking its suction from the discharge of the preceding impeller)
A <NOISE HOOD> is a <HOOD> that is intended to protect primarily surroundings from equipment noise effects
A <NON CARTRIDGE MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> that must be assembled from components when installed.
A <NON LUBRICATED BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> where no lubrication is in place

SuperClass: EXTRACTION BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE, EXTRACTION CONDENSING STEAM TURBINE
TextDefinition: A <NON-AUTOMATIC EXTRACTION CONDENSING STEAM TURBINE> is an <EXTRACTION BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE> where extraction takes place without means for controlling the pressures of the extracted steam

A <NON-CIRCULAR GEAR> is a <GEAR> with a pair of gears that are anything but circular. It has special characteristics, where the main objective might be ratio variations, axle displacement oscillations, etc
A <NON-CLOG PUMP is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is intended to pump fluids containing solid particles without clogging
A <NON-DRIVE END BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> for a non-drive end of a driver, i.e. for support of the end of the shaft where torque is not transferred
A <NON-DRIVE END RADIAL/THRUST BEARING> is a <NON-DRIVE END BEARING> and a <RADIAL/THRUST BEARING> that is located at a non-drive end.
A <NON-DRIVEN END BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that can be installed at non-driven end
A <NON-DRIVEN END RADIAL BEARING> is a <RADIAL BEARING> that is located at the non-driven end of a shaft
A <NON-REVERSIBLE DIESEL ENGINE> is a <2-STROKE ENGINE> that is a diesel engine designed to run in one direction only.
A <NOZZLE BLOCK> is an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> that is an assembly of converging-diverging nozzles plus a row of reversing blades that is part of a steam chest of a steam turbine
A <NOZZLE RING> is a <RING> that is bolted to the inner circumference of a steam chest
An <OIL BOOSTER PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <BOOSTING> the pressure (head) of an oil supply
An <OIL CONDITIONER> is a <CENTRIFUGE> that is intended to remove free and dissolved water as well as entrained gases from oil
An <OIL CONTROL BEARING RING> is a <RING> intended to control oil flow in a bearing
An <OIL HEATER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HEATER> that heats oil
An <OIL LUBRICATED BEARING> is a <LUBRICATED BEARING> intended to be lubricated with oil.
An <OIL LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> intended to lubricate rotating or moving items with oil
An <OIL MIST LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> that is designed to spray oil into a air or gas stream and thereby lubricate rotating parts in a consumer e.g an air motor or cylinder
An <OIL PAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONTAINER> and that is the lower section of the crankcase used as a lubricating-oil reservoir on an internal combustion engine
An <OIL PRESSURE LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> that is a lubrication appliance supplying lubrication oil under pressure to a bearing or machine part
An <OIL RESERVOIR> is a <RESERVOIR> that stores oil
An <OIL RETAINING RING> is a <RING> intended to retain oil in the bearing housing and prevent entry of foreign material
An <OIL SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> utilizing oil seal rings
An <OIL SLINGER> is a <RING> that is mounted onto the piston rod off the inboard distance piece in order to prevent possible oil leakage from the oil wiper packing to the outboard distance piece area
An <OIL SYSTEM> is an <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> and a <LIQUID SYSTEM> that that provides pressurized oil to various equipment components
An <OIL WIPER PACKING> is a <PACKING(seal)> that is located off the partition between the crosshead guide and the inboard distance piece to prevent any oil leaving the crosshead guide
An <OIL-LUBRICATED GEAR COUPLING> is a <GEAR COUPLING> which is oil lubricated.
An <OILY PRODUCTION WATER SUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUMP> holding polluted water for separation by gravity
An <OPEN LINE SHAFT> is a <LINE SHAFT> intended to run (inside the column pipe) fully exposed to the pumped liquid.
An <OPEN LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a  <LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> provided with an open line shaft by which the shaft is fully exposed to the pumped medium
An <OPEN PUMP IMPELLER> is a <PUMP IMPELLER> that consists of nothing but vanes, without impeller front and back cover, attached to a central hub for mounting on the shaft.
An <OREDA OIL HANDLING SYSTEM> is an <OIL SYSTEM> that includes oil handling as defined by OREDA (Offshore and Onshore Reliability Data).
An <OUTBOARD BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is located closest to the shaft-end
An <OUTBOARD DISTANCE PIECE> is a <DISTANCE PIECE> that is located at the cylinder end of the equipment.
An <OUTPUT SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is the exit of mechanical energy and driver of an external energy consumer.
An <OVERHEAD TANK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TANK> that stores liquid overhead
An <OVERHUNG CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the impeller or impellers are mounted on the end of a shaft which is cantilevered or overhung from its bearing supports
An <OXYGEN SCAVENGER SYSTEM> is a <CHEMICAL INJECTION SYSTEM> that includes service for loading, storage, pumping and distribution of oxygen scavenger.
A <PACKAGE ASSEMBLY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PACKAGE> that is an assembly of artefacts to be managed as one for some purpose
A <PACKAGING SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> for the preparation of goods for transport, warehousing, logistics, sale, and end use

A <PACKED PLUNGER PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING CONTROLLED VOLUME PUMP> utilizing plunger(s) with packing or seals to restrict leakage, driven from an outside source including a mechanism for varying the effective displacement
A <PACKING GLAND> is a <GLAND> intended to prevent packing to move.
A <PACKING RING> is a <PACKING(seal)> and a <RING> intended to prevent leakage
A <PACKING(seal)> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that uses several coils of woven material pressed lightly against a moving shaft to provide a minimal leakage path between a shaft and a casing
A <PAD BEARING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is provided with pads to form an oil wedge
A <PADDLE TYPE IMPELLER> is a <RADIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER> that is provided with two (2) large-radial paddles and typically applied in solid suspension and blending applications.
A <PARALLEL SHAFT GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> where the input and output shaft axises are parallel
A <PARSONS TURBINE> is a <REACTION STEAM TURBINE> that is of the multi-stage design
A <PEDESTAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is the base or foot of a column or other upright structure
A <PELTON TURBINE> is a <HYDRAULIC IMPULSE TURBINE> operated from a high head source with small flow rate
A <PENETRATOR FOR HYDRAULIC LINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <PENETRATOR> for a hydraulic line

A <PERIPHERAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> with a special <IMPELLER> with a large number of radial blades by which the fluid is discharged from one blade and tranferred to the root of the next blade giving additional energy.

SuperClass: INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE, RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE
TextDefinition: A <PETROL ENGINE> is an <INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE> and a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> that is an induction compression ignition exhaust engine which ignites a petrol air mixture with an electric spark
A <PIG LAUNCHER> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <LAUNCHING> a <PIPE PIG> into a pipeline
A <PILLOW BLOCK BEARING> is a <RADIAL BEARING> intended for guidance.
A <PINION GEAR> is a <GEAR> that is normally the smaller of two meshing gears.
A <PINION SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is driving and supporting the pinion gear in a gear box assembly.
A <PIPE RACK> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> and a <SUPPORT> for <PIPING SYSTEM>s
A <PIPELINE PROTECTIVE STRUCTURE> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> used to protect a pipeline from external damage or interference

A <PISTON> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> and a <DISPLACER> that is normally of the cylindrical shape and provided with a closed end, intended to reciprocate within a hollow outer cylinder to change the internal volume of the outer cylinder  in order to either discharge pressurized liquid or gas
A <PISTON COMPRESSOR> is a <RECIPROCATING COMPRESSOR> in which the compressing and displacing element is a piston intended to have a reciprocating motion within a cylinder.
A <PISTON CROWN> is a <Feature> that is the top part of a piston with skirt, used in two-stroke diesel engines, equipped with grooves to accommodate the piston rings
A <PISTON CYLINDER> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> which is a tubular chamber in which the piston of an engine, pump, comprssor or actuator reciprocates.
A <PISTON CYLINDER BOLTING> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that includes a set of bolting (bolts/studs and nuts) for connection of the cylinder covers to the cylinder body.
A <PISTON CYLINDER FLANGE BOLTING> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that includes a set of bolting (bolts/studs and nuts) for connection of the cylinder flange to the distance piece.

A <PISTON ENGINE> is an <INTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE> in which the combustion takes place inside a chamber where the rising pressure acts on a piston through which pressure energy is transformed into rotating energy.
A <PISTON ENGINE BED PLATE> is a <CASING> that is a machine casing that is the bottom casing of a 2-stroke diesel engine constituting the crankcase and containing the crankshaft and journal bearings
A <PISTON ENGINE BLOCK> is an <ENGINE BLOCK> that is a major part of a piston engine, machined to receive the cylinders(s) and the crankshaft.
A <PISTON ENGINE BLOCK ASSEMBLY> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is the assembly of the parts constituting a split engine block, like the cylinder column, frame box, piston engine bed plate, etc.

UniqueName: PISTON ENGINE CYLINDER AND PISTON ASSEMBLY
TextDefinition: A <PISTON ENGINE CYLINDER AND PISTON ASSEMBLY> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is an assembly of the cylinder and piston with belonging parts in a reciprocating piston engine.
A <PISTON ENGINE CYLINDER ASSEMBLY> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is an assembly of the cylinder (cylinder liner, cylinder jacket, frame box) and cylinder head.
A <PISTON EXTRUDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EXTRUDER> that uses a piston in a batch process
A <PISTON NUT> is a <NUT> intended for use to fixate the piston rod to the piston
A <PISTON PACKING> is a <PACKING(seal)> that is a sealing element designed to seal against an outher diameter and prevent leakage between a piston and a cylinder wall

A <PISTON PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> that contains pistons intended to reciprocate within cylinders with the valving accomplished by rotation of the pistons and cylinders relative to the ports. The cylinders may be axially or radially disposed and arranged.
A <PISTON RIDER RING> is a <RING> that is a rectangular ring with a small opening and serves as piston wear band inside the cylinder

A <PISTON RING> is a <PISTON PACKING> that consists of a set of rectangular rings with a small opening located inside the groove of a piston to serve both as compression- or liquid buffer and to seal against the outer cylinder diameter to prevent leakage between subject piston and cylinder wall.
A <PISTON ROD> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is a connection between a piston and a crosshead.
A <PISTON ROD BACK-UP RING> is a <RING> that is mounted behind each set of packing rings in case of a piston rod packing assembly
A <PISTON ROD PACKING> is a <PACKING(seal)> intended to seal against an inner diameter and prevent leakage between a cylinder and a rod
A <PISTON ROD PACKING FLANGE> is a <FLANGE> intended to serve as covering flange to fixate and press the packing rings together
A <PISTON ROD PACKING RING> is a <PACKING RING> intended to serve as sealing ring together with other rings in order to prevent process fluid leakage.
A <PISTON ROD PRESSURE PACKING ASSEMBLY> is an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> that consist of all parts belonging to a piston rod pressure packing as flange, packing rings, back-up rings etc

A <PISTON ROD STUFFING BOX> is a <STUFFING BOX> that is a chamber packed with fluid-tight elastic material, through which the piston rod is made to pass in order to prevent leakage of gases from the piston underside into the crankcase.

A <PISTON THRUST BALANCER> is a <THRUST BALANCE ASSEMBLY> utilising a piston (drum) keyed or screwed to the shaft rotating within a stationary cylinder fixed to the pump casing and separating the balancing chamber from the pump interior. The resultant of the forces acting on the balancing piston by the discharge pressure on the inside and discharge pressure on the outside tend to counteract the thrust on the shaft caused by the impellers
A <PITCHED-BLADE MIXER IMPELLER> is an <AXIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER> that contains axial flow blades. Typically with four blades positioned at constant angles of 45 degree.
A <PLAIN BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that is plain
A <PLAIN BEARING BUSHING> is a <BEARING BUSHING> intended to form the bearing liner in a plain bearing. Typically made of composite material.
A <PLANETARY GEARBOX> is an <EPICYCLIC GEARBOX> that contains a planet wheel carrier which is integral with the output shaft.
A <PLASTIC LINED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is provided with a plastic liner for internal parts
A <PLUNGER> is a <PISTON> that is a single acting solid piston or a ram.
A <PLUNGER PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> that uses a plunger either or not in combination with a diaphragm or piston to pressurize liquids at relatively low capacities and higher heads.
A <PNEUMATIC MOTOR> is an <AIR MOTOR> that is driven by compressed gas (typically air)
A <PNEUMATIC MOTOR RECIPROCATING> is a <PNEUMATIC MOTOR> utilizing reciprocating motion which usually is converted into rotary motion.
A <PNEUMATIC MOTOR ROTARY> is a <PNEUMATIC MOTOR> utilizing a rotor or turbine wheel to convert pressure energy into rotational energy.
A <PNEUMATIC SHOCK ABSORBER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SHOCK ABSORBER> that uses a cylinder filled with a gas
A <PNEUMATIC START SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <START SYSTEM> that uses pressurized gas as a power source to start a driver

A <PNEUMATICALLY ACTUATED DIAPHRAGM PUMP> is a <CONTROLLED VOLUME DIAPHRAGM PUMP> of which the motive force is air. The single acting diaphragm pump is often used as metering pump for high heads and small capacities. The double acting diaphragm (mostly air driven) pump is used for moderate capacities at low heads (non metering)
A <POLYELECTROLYTE HANDLING SYSTEM> is a <CHEMICAL INJECTION SYSTEM> for loading, storage, pumping and distribution of polyelectrolyte.
A <PORTABLE PUMP> an <ARTEFACT> and <PUMP> that can either be carried by hand or can be mounted
A <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> intended to compress and transport gas according to the reciprocating or rotary displacement principle

A <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> intended to transport liquid through the reciprocating or rotary displacement principle and with either fixed or adjustable volume flow rates. NOTE - Combine with either BARE PUMP or PUMP SYSTEM,
A <POTABLE WATER PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <POTABLE WATER>
A <POWER GENERATION GAS TURBINE> is a <GAS TURBINE> that is used for power generation
A <POWER GENERATION SYSTEM> is a <GENERATOR> and a <SYSTEM> that is designed to generate <ELECTRIC POWER>
A <PRESS(machine)> is a <MACHINE> and a <PRESS>  that is capable of <PRESSING>
A <PRESSURE BALANCING TUBE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> and a <BALANCER> that provides hydraulic balance between pump suction and bottom of submersible electric motor oil reservoir
A <PRESSURE COMPOUND TURBINE> is a <STEAM TURBINE> where the pressure drop may be split with a number of stages and the velocity is absorbed over a number of bladed wheels

A <PRESSURE LUBRICATION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATION SYSTEM> were the lubrication function is achieved by a lubricant that is circulated under pressure through channels or piping to the lubricating points by a lubricating oil pump
A <PRIMARY SEAL GAS VENT> is a <VENT PORT> that is the first vent downstream the inboard self-acting dry gas seal and that is normally connected to the flare.
A <PROBE HOLDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> intended to house a probe element only
A <PRODUCTION LINE ISA95>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WORK CENTER> that is a series of pieces of equipment dedicated to the manufacture of a specific number of products or families
A <PRODUCTION MODULE STRUCTURE> is a <MODULE STRUCTURE> that is a structural facility of the production module.

A <PRODUCTION UNIT ISA95> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WORK CENTER> that is a set of production equipment that converts, separates, or reacts one or more feedstocks to produce intermediate or final products
A <PROPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <IMPELLER> that is an axial flow impeller which is typically unenclosed
A <PROPELLER MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that comprises of a rotating shaft with propeller blades attached
A <PROPELLER PUMP>  is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP that is provided with a propeller type impeller to generate relativly low head at large flows
A <PROPELLER SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> intended for a propeller.
A <PROPELLER SHAFT COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is intended to connect a propeller shaft to gear or engine shaft
A <PROPELLER TURBINE> is a <KAPLAN TURBINE> with non-adjustable runner blades suitable for non-varying head sources
A <PROPORTIONING PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is intended to transport accurate liquid quantities according to the positive displacement pump principle
A <PROPULSION ENGINE> is an <ENGINE> utilized as propulsion engine for a craft, vessel or boat
A <PROPULSION TRANSMISSION SYSTEM> is a <TRANSMISSION SYSTEM> intended for propulsion transmission.
A <PULP PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <PULP>

A <PULSATION DAMPER> is a <DAMPER> and a <PRESSURIZED CONTAINER> located in both pump- and compressor piping systems in order to reduce residual pulsation fluctuations, as a result of discontinue operation effects, within an allowable level specified
A <PUMP> is a <FunctionalObject> that is capable of <PUMPING> but may require parts and subsystems for that capability; including those turns it into a <PUMP SYSTEM>
A <PUMP AUXILIARY SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> that that is an assembly of functional units necessary for running a pump unit
A <PUMP BARREL> is a <BARREL ENCLOSURE> that is the pump enclosure containing either the inner casing or bolted-up stage section.
A <PUMP BOWL> is a  <CASING> intended to contain an impeller in a pump
A <PUMP CAN> is a <CASING> in which a pump and possibly a motor can be mounted
A <PUMP CASING> is a  <CASING> and a single wall surrounding the impeller. The suction and discharge nozzles form an integral part of the casing. Typically applied for centrifugal pumps
A <PUMP FOOT> is a <FOOT SUPPORT> that is the particular part of the pump assembly on which the pump is mounted.
A <PUMP IMPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <IMPELLER> that forms part of a rotating assembly of a pump imparting kinetic energy to the liquid being pumped
A <PUMP SEAL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL SYSTEM> that provides seal flushing to the pump seals
A <PUMP SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> of a pump that is provided with impeller(s), bearings, bushings, sealing elements etc.
A <PUMP STATION> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FACILITY> that is a collection of pumps and related equipment intended to enable liquid transport through a pipeline sytem
A <PUMP SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP>, consisting of one or more <BARE PUMP>s and auxilliary systems and parts

A <PUMPING RING> is a <RING> that is external and threaded, intended to be mounted between the seals in a dual-, tripple- or tandem mechanical seal in order to circulate or pump the buffer fluid through the seal chamber and back to the reservoir. It is basically a screw mounted on the pump shaft used to ensure positive circulation of fluid from seal chamber to reservoir
A <PUMPJACK> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DRIVER(function)> that is an aboveground drive for a reciprocating <PISTON PUMP> in an <OIL WELL>
A <PURGE AIR SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> that that provides pressurized air to either equipment or equipment auxiliaries intended to remove possible dangerous gases

A <PURGE GAS SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <INERT GAS SYSTEM> for supplying purge gas (normally nitrogen or other inert gas) for purging of processing equipment normally exposed for HC gas (or other explosive atmosphere)
A <PURGE PORT> is a <GAS INLET PORT> that is intended to provide connection for the purging gas facility to a device
A <PUSH ROD> is a <ROD> through which the tappet of an overhead-valve engine operates the rocker arm, when the camshaft is located in the crankcase.
A <PUSHER TYPE SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> that is A <MECHANICAL SEAL> wherein a secondary seal is pushed along the shaft or shaft sleeve to compensate for face wear.
A <PUSHROD> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is transmitting motion from the camshaft to the rocker arm that in its turn opens the suction or exhaust valve on a reciprocating piston engine.
A <QUILL SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is configuration by which bending moments and thrust of the driven equipment are compensated for by means of sliding teeth and/or a flexible coupling in between.

A <QUILL-SHAFT COUPLING> is a <FLEXIBLE COUPLING> designed to accommodate angular misalignment, parallel (or lateral) offset and torsional fluctuations by elastic deformation of a relatively long slender shaft. <NOTE Q>uill-shaft couplings cannot normally accommodate axial displacement.

A <RACK AND PINION GEAR> is a <GEAR> is a type of linear actuator that comprises a circular gear (the pinion) engaging a linear gear (the rack), which operate to translate rotational motion into linear motion. Driving the pinion into rotation causes the rack to be driven linearly. Driving the rack linearly will cause the pinion to be driven into a rotation.
A <RADIAL BALL BEARING> is a <RADIAL BEARING> that is also a ball bearing.
A <RADIAL BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> intended to support a shaft or rotor in radial direction
A <RADIAL BEARING ASSEMBLY> is an <ASSEMBLY> of a <RADIAL BEARING> and associated parts
A <RADIAL BEARING BRACKET> is a <BEARING BRACKET> that is a support for a radial bearing assembly.
A <RADIAL BEARING DRIVEN END> is a <RADIAL BEARING> that is located at the driven end of a shaft.
A <RADIAL BEARING HOUSING> is a <BEARING HOUSING> intended to house a radial bearing.
A <RADIAL BEARING PAD> is a <BEARING PAD> that is intended for a radial bearing.
A <RADIAL BEARING SLEEVE> is a <BEARING SLEEVE> that is a load carrying part of a radial sleeve bearing
A <RADIAL FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> with axial inlet and radial outlet
A <RADIAL FLOW GAS TURBINE> is a <GAS TURBINE> where the gas flow is made to discharge radially to the periphery of the runner
A <RADIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER> is a <MIXER IMPELLER> intended to produce flow along the impeller radius in distinct patterns with relatively more shear and smaller flow rates in mixing fluids.
A <RADIAL FLOW PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that uses a radial flow impeller.

A <RADIAL FLOW PUMP IMPELLER> is a <PUMP IMPELLER> where the flow direction is radial to the shaft axis and the values of specific speed are relatively low. It can have either a single or double suction and be of the open, closed or semi-open design.
A <RADIAL LABYRINTH SHAFT SEAL> is a <LABYRINTH SHAFT SEAL> where the labyrinth chambers are located radially around the shaft.

A <RADIAL PISTON PUMP> is a <PISTON PUMP> that contains pistons arranged like wheel spokes around a cylindrical block. A drive shaft rotates this cylindrical block which pushes or slings the pistons, causing compression and expansion. The eccentricity between the piston housing and cylinder block centerlines determines the piston stroke. These pumps have a low noise level, very high loads at the lowest speeds, and high efficiency.
A <RADIAL PLAIN BEARING> is a <PLAIN BEARING> and a <RADIAL BEARING>
A <RADIAL ROLLER BEARING> is a <RADIAL BEARING> and a <ROLLER BEARING> that is capable of providing both axial and radial support simultanously.
A <RADIAL SPLIT MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> where the wearing parts or the hole seal can be split to make it possible to change parts without dismounting the hole machine.
A <RADIAL TURBINE MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> where the flow moves away from to the impeller shaft
A <RADIAL/THRUST BALL BEARING> is a <BALL BEARING> and a <RADIAL/THRUST BEARING>
A <RADIAL/THRUST BEARING> is a <RADIAL BEARING> and a <THRUST BEARING> that is capable of providing both axial and radial support simultanously.
A <RADIAL/THRUST PLAIN BEARING> is a <PLAIN BEARING> and a <RADIAL/THRUST BEARING>
A <RADIAL/THRUST ROLLER BEARING> is a <ROLLER BEARING> and a <RADIAL/THRUST BEARING>

A <REACTION STEAM TURBINE> is a <STEAM TURBINE> and a <REACTION TURBINE> that is provided with stationary blades, which direct steam into passages between moving blades. The pressure drops across both fixed and moving blades

SuperClass: KINETIC TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER, TURBINE
TextDefinition: A <REACTION TURBINE> is  a <TURBINE> and a <KINETIC TO MECHANICAL ENERGY CONVERTER>  in which a fluid acts both by its kinetic energy and by its pressure
A <RECIPROCATING AIR MOTOR> is an <AIR MOTOR> intended to use reciprocating motion which usually is converted into rotary motion

A <RECIPROCATING COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT COMPRESSOR> in which forced reduction of gas volume takes place by the movement of a displacing element in a cylinder or enclosure

A <RECIPROCATING CONTROLLED VOLUME PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> with variable displacement control used for displacing an accurate predetermined volume of liquid within a specified time. The construction includes a mechanism for varying the effective plunger, piston or diaphragm displacement.

A <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> is a <PISTON ENGINE> which employs a piston working in a cylinder. The piston being caused to oscillate by the periodic pressure of the working fuid, transfering the linear motion to rotating motion through its connection to a crankshaft.
A <RECIPROCATING PRESSURE AGGLOMERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AGGLOMERATOR> which uses pistons to produce pressure and to form material

A <RECIPROCATING PUMP> is a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> which contains a displacing element intended to be moved in a reciprocating movement to exert pressure on a fluid, typically moving within a cylindrical space.
A <REDUCTION GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is capable of rotational speed reduction
A <REFRIGERANT PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <REFRIGERANT>

A <REFRIGERATION EVAPORATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EVAPORATOR> in a in a refrigeration system,where the refrigerant is changing state from a liquid to a vapor (boiling), at a pressure and temperature that is about 15 to 20 degrees Celsius below the desired final temperature of the space or product being cooled
A <RESERVOIR> is a <CONTAINER> that is intended to contain a reserve of liquid. Typically at atmospheric pressure
A <RESTRICTIVE RING SEAL> is a <COMPRESSOR SEAL> that is provided with carbon rings in retainers in order to prevent gas leakage.
A <RETAINER SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> that has the function to apply force to a retainer ring

A <RETAINING CAGE> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is a rolling element bearing component with the main purpose of keeping the rolling elements at an appropriate distance from each other and minimize the friction.
A <RETURN SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING>he movement of a device is returned to its neutral position by a spring
A <REVERSIBLE DIESEL ENGINE> is a <2-STROKE ENGINE> that is a diesel engine designed to run in both directions.

A <REVERSIBLE ROTOR BLADE> is a <ROTOR BLADE> as part of a set of adjustable rotor vanes fitted around a rotational axis by which the rotor is preceded by an inlet stator and followed by a downstream stator each provided with guide vanes designed so as to be mirror-symmetrical to the radial center plane of the rotor and may be adjusted at an angle to the direction of flow in such a way that at reversible flow direction the inlet stator takes on the function of a downstream stator and the downstream stator takes on the function of an inlet stator.
A <REVERSING MOTOR> is a <MOTOR> which has the ability to supply rotating energy in two oposite directions
A <RIBBON BLENDER> is a <BLENDER> and a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that has thin, ribbon-shaped metal mixers that perform the blending
A <RIGHT-ANGLE GEARBOX> is a <CROSSED AXIS GEARBOX> that is a gear box with crossed-axis gears at right angles.

A <RIGID COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is stiff and which is used to connect machines where it is desired to maintain shafts in precise alignment, or when the rotor of one machine is used to support and position the other rotor
A <RIGIDLY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that has a <RIGID COUPLING>

A <RING OIL LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> were the lubricating function is achieved by a lose metal ring, rotating with the shaft inside the bearing housing, dipping into oil and lifting oil from the reservoir up to the area requiring lubrication
A <ROCKER ARM> is a <ROD> that is a pivoted lever. In machinery operated by pushrods or overhead camshaft, wich carry the tappets of an overhead valve system.

A <ROCKER ARM COVER> is a <PROTECTION COVER> comprising shells having an upper portion and a lower portion formed by inner and outer side walls and end walls contiguous therewith; a lid is fitted to the upper portion of the rocker arm cover to provide an enclosed cavity for housing the plurality of ignition coils if present.
A <ROCKER COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is bolted on over rocker arms in an internal combustion engine

A <ROD DROP SENSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DETECTOR> giving an indication of the vertical piston movement inside the cylinder, calculated from the measurement of piston rod movement at the pressure packing case. It is located in the distance piece to detect wear of the piston wear bands

A <ROD PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> using a rod attached to an assembly of check valves and other components. By the reciprocating movement of the rod liquid will be forced through the valves. These pumps are often driven by an air balancing unit
A <ROLLER BEARING> is a <ROLLING ELEMENT BEARING> utilizing cylindrical, conical or spherical rollers.
A <ROLLER CHAIN FLEXIBLE COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL CONTACT COUPLING> which employs two sprocket-like members mounted one on each of the two shafts and connected by an annulus of roller chain.
A <ROLLING ELEMENT BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that utilizes rolling balls, cylinders and other rolling elements between tracks
A <ROTARY AIR MOTOR> is an <AIR MOTOR> intended to use a rotor or turbine wheel to convert pressure energy into rotational energy

A <ROTARY BELT PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> with a rotary belt mounted inside the pumping house. The belt is fixed between the suction and discharge sides, while rotators turn inside the belt, effectively sealing the inflow and outflow conduits in turn. The constant sealing between suction and discharge sides eliminates backflow problems, and the small number of moving parts makes operation and maintenance easy
A <ROTARY COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT COMPRESSOR> in which compression displacement is effected by the positive action of rotating elements

A <ROTARY COOLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLER> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that princippally consist of an inclined rotating cylinder that is enclosed in a cooling jacket and used for cooling down fine powder or granular materials
A <ROTARY DRUM FILTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FILTER> that consists of a perforated drum covered by a filter sheet

A <ROTARY PUMP> is a <POSITIVE DISPLACEMENT PUMP> that consists of a chamber containing gears, cams, screws, vanes, plungers or similar elements actuated by relative rotation of the drive shaft or casing and which has no separate inlet and outlet valves.

A <ROTATING ARM CENTRALIZER> is an <ARM CENTRALIZER> and a <ROTATING CENTRALIZER> that has an arm extending outward at an angle from the pipe to that it is fixed. The <CENTRALIZER> is fixed to the pipe such that it can rotate.
A <ROTATING CENTRALIZER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CENTRALIZER> that can be made to rotatin relation to the pipe
A <ROTATING EQUIPMENT ENGINEERING DISCIPLINE> is a <DISCIPLINE> that is capable of <ROTATING EQUIPMENT ENGINEERING>
A <ROTATING EQUIPMENT SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> using rotating equipment as main equipment
A <ROTATING GROWTH AGGLOMERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AGGLOMERATOR> which uses a <PELLETIZER DISC> to produce <PELLET>s
A <ROTATING LABYRINTH SEAL> is a <LABYRINTH SEAL> that has teeth on a <ROTOR>
