A <ROTATING ONE-PIECE CENTRALIZER> is an <ONE-PIECE CENTRALIZER> and a <ROTATING CENTRALIZER> that is essentially manufactured in one piece, ie. cast. The <CENTRALIZER> is made to rotate in relation to the pipe.
A <ROTATING PISTON ENGINE> is a <PISTON ENGINE> which employs a rotating piston working inside a chamber. The piston being caused to rotate by the periodic pressure of the working fluid.
A <ROTATING PRESSURE AGGLOMERATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AGGLOMERATOR> which uses <BRIQUETTING ROLLER>s to produce pressure and to form material

A <ROTATING SEAT GAS SEAL> is a <GAS LUBRICATED MECHANICAL SEAL> that is dry running and contains a rotating mating ring (called a seat ring). Typically used in media that contain solids or having tendency of scaling.
A <ROTATION ARROW> is a <Feature> that is engraved on or attached to a casing part of rotating equipment machinery to indicate the direction of rotation
A <ROTOR BLADE> is a <TURBINE BLADE> as part of a rotor blade arrangement provided in a serie of rows opposing a plurality of stator vanes in rotating machinery
A <RUBBER BELLOW MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <BELLOW MECHANICAL SEAL> utilising flexible rubber bellows to act both as pusher spring and to provide secondary sealing.
A <RUBBER BELLOW SEAL> is a <BELLOW SEAL> that contains flexible rubber bellows to act both as pusher spring and to provide secondary sealing.
A <RUBBER LINED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is provided with a rubber lining
A <RUBBER TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> is a <TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> where the turning mass is connected to the driver plate by vulcanized rubber
A <RUPTURE DISC PORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID PORT> that enables a <RUPTURE DISC> to be attached
A <SAFETY VALVE PORT PORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID PORT> that enables a <SAFETY VALVE> to be attached
A <SAMPLING PORT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID PORT> to be inserted or attached
A <SCALE INHIBITOR SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID DISTRIBUTION SYSTEM> intended for loading, storage, pumping and distribution of scale inhibitor

A <SCAVENGE AIR AUXILIARY BLOWER> is an <AIR BLOWER>, normally electric driven, that is brought into operation to supply air to the manifold when the diesel engine is running on part load and the turbocharger capacity is low or absent.
A <SCREW> is a <SHAFT> with a helical shaped shaft design.
A <SCREW AND WHEEL PUMP> is a <SCREW PUMP> that contains one screw-rotor that together with a plate wheel forms cavities that are transported from suction to discharge as the screw rotates the wheel.
A <SCREW COMPRESSOR> is a <ROTARY COMPRESSOR> in which compression is carried out by the intermeshing of two helical or differently formed screws, which transport the gas from inlet to outlet.
A <SCREW COMPRESSOR SUCTION COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is containing gas inlet nozzle and bearing assemblies for male- and female rotor shafts
A <SCREW EXTRUDER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <EXTRUDER> that contains one or more extruder screws
A <SCREW PUMP> is a <ROTARY PUMP> that contains one or more meshing screws within a casing to form liquid cavities that are transported axially from suction to discharge.

A <SCROLL CENTRIFUGE> is a <CENTRIFUGE> by which product is fed in either a horizontal or vertical rotating conico-cylindrical bowl. Solids settle at the bowl due to centrifugal force &amp;amp;amp; transported to the narrow end by the scroll rotating at slightly higher speed then bowl. Fluid is discharged at the opposite side
A <SEA WATER PUMP> is a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <SEAWATER>; it is a standard centrifugal pump with duplex or super duplex metallurgy
A <SEAL ASSEMBLY> is an <ASSEMBLY>s including auxiliaries
A <SEAL COLLAR> is a <COLLAR> intended to serve as a band or ring usually attached by setscrews to a shaft that acts to set and attach the rotary unit of a mechanical seal to the shaft.
A <SEAL COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a removable closure containing the shaft seal assembly for the male rotor shaft
A <SEAL CUP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is a sealing element made of flexible material
A <SEAL DRIVE> is a <RING> that is mounted onto the shaft sleeve and causes the seal spring, spring holder, u-cup and rotating face to rotate in combination with the drive key
A <SEAL DRIVE KEY> is a <SHAFT KEY> that is used in combination with the seal drive to have the non-stationary parts of the seals rotated
A <SEAL DRIVE SLEEVE> is an <SLEEVE> that serves as support sleeve for the rotating face
A <SEAL END PLATE> is a <PLATE> that is an end-plate intended to connect the non-rotating portion of a seal to a seal housing
A <SEAL FLUSHING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL SYSTEM> intended to deliver sealing fluid to seals in order to provide a liquid film between the seal faces and to remove friction heat
A <SEAL GAS CONDENSATE OUTLET> is a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> intended to drain seal gas
A <SEAL GAS INLET> is a <FLUID INLET PORT> intended for the supply of seal gas

A <SEAL GAS SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL SYSTEM> intended to deliver pressurized sealing gas in order to ensure a proper operation of dry gas seals including control of leakage to flare and / or vent
A <SEAL GAS VENT> is a <VENT PORT> intended to vent seal gas
A <SEAL GLAND ASSEMBLY> is an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> that consists of gland, bolting and non-rotating portion of a seal

A <SEAL JACKET> is a <JACKET> that can be either part of the seal gland assembly or the pump casing off the seal in order to control the temperature of the seal and hence proper functioning of the seal.

A <SEAL KIT> is a <MACHINE COMPONENT> that is a collection of gaskets and/or lip seals, sealing rings and related components, and been found essential or useful to be collected in a spare part package for a certain machine or unit
A <SEAL OIL INLET> is a <FLUID INLET PORT> intended for the supply of seal oil
A <SEAL OIL OUTLET > is a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> intended to drain seal oil
A <SEAL OIL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL SYSTEM> and an <OIL SYSTEM> that provides seal oil to seals of equipment involved
A <SEAL ORIFICE> is a <RESTRICTION ORIFICE> intended to limit the flow of seal flush to the seal
A <SEAL O-RING> is an <O-RING> used to create leak free joints between mechanical seal components, the shaft and casing.
A <SEAL SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> that is located between collar and compression ring and used to push seal faces together in order to have a constant pressure on the rotating seal ring
A <SEAL SPRING HOLDER> is a <RING> that is located between the rotating face and the seal spring and serves as spring retainer ring

A <SEAL SUPPORT SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SYSTEM> that is designed to keep high process security and are developed to seal products within their emission limits. ... Main task of a seal support system is the cooling effect and a controlled lubrication of the mechanical seal faces
A <SEAL SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <AUXILIARY SYSTEM> that that is the configuration of hardware components in order to have seals flushed with pressurized fluid
A <SEAL WEDGE> is a <DYNAMIC SEAL> conically shaped rotating seal ring.

A <SEALING STRIP> is a <STRIP> intended to minimize leakage and typically applied in steam turbines preventing steam leakage to pass a steam turbine blade tip into the following nozzle and mounted between blade shrouds and casing diaphragms.
A <SEALING STRIP LABYRINTH SEAL> is a <LABYRINTH SEAL> that has stripes fixed to the shaft with <CAULKING WIRE>
A <SEALLESS CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that does not contain conventional seals but prevent leakage of the pumped liquid to the atmosphere by other means
A <SEAT GASKET> is an <O-RING> that seals the stationary face vs. the seal end plate.
A <SEAWATER COOLING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COOLING SYSTEM> that uses sea water as the cooling medium
A <SEAWATER LIFT PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LIFT PUMP> that can be used for seawater
A <SEDIMENT PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <SEDIMENT>
A <SELF LUBRICATED GEAR COUPLING> is a gear coupling that is self lubricated.
A <SELF PRIMING CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is designed have the ability to prime itself automatically, after being initially filled and operating under a suction lift.

A <SELF-ALIGNING BALL BEARING> is a <BALL BEARING> that has two rows of balls with two separate raceways in the inner ring and a common sphered raceway in the outer ring, permitting angular misalignment of the shaft relative to the housing.
A <SELF-LEVELING PLATE> is a <LEVELING PLATE> that is self-leveling

A <SEMI SPLIT MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <RADIAL SPLIT MECHANICAL SEAL> where the wearing parts of the seal, i.e the primary ring, mating ring and o-rings, can be split to make it possible to change parts without dismounting the hole machine.
A <SEMICAST ENGINE BED PLATE> is a <PISTON ENGINE BED PLATE> that is partly made of cast iron and partly of welded steel.

A <SEMI-DIESEL ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> in which the fuel is injected into the cylinder by means of a fuel pump after compression of the air charge. As the compression heat is less than in a diesel engine, the the fuel is ignited by a hot bulb.
A <SEMI-OPEN IMPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMPELLER> consisting of a hub, blades and back cover
A <SEMI-OPEN PUMP IMPELLER> is a <PUMP IMPELLER> with vanes partly supported by a shroud on the back of the impeller.
A <SEPARATE BEARING FRAME MOUNTED CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> where the pump bearing frames are supporting the pump casing in between.

UniqueName: SEPARATE DISCHARGE LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
TextDefinition: A <SEPARATE DISCHARGE LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <> line shaft centrifugal pump utilizing a separate column as discharge line

A <SEPARATELY COUPLED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the centrifugal pump shaft and driver shaft are two separate parts linked together by a flexible (elastic) or rigid power transmission coupling
A <SEPARATION AND STABILISATION SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> intended to provide separation and stabilisation capabilities
A <SEPARATION GAS INLET> is a <FLUID INLET PORT> intended for the supply of separation gas
A <SEPARATION GAS VENT> is a <VENT CONNECTION POINT> intended to vent separation gas
A <SEPARATION SEAL> is a <COMPRESSOR SHAFT END SEAL> intended to prevent leakage between gas seal and bearing
A <SERVOMOTOR> is a <MOTOR> that serves as a drive for control or steering mechanisms

A <SEVEN STAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> in which the head is developed by seven impellers operating in series (each taking its suction from the discharge of the preceding impeller)
A <SEWAGE PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <SEWAGE>

A <SHAFT> is an <ENGINE COMPONENT> that is the core rotating element on which the rotating parts are mounted and through which energy is either transmitted from the prime mover or generated in case of a driver.
A <SHAFT END SEAL ASSEMBLY> is a <SEAL ASSEMBLY>s
A <SHAFT KEY> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BLOCKER> and that is assembled with a shaft and a hub to prevent the hub rotating about the shaft
A <SHAFT SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> intended to prevent leakage around a rotating or reciprocating shaft, where the shaft passes through a machine casing

A <SHAFT SLEEVE> is an <SLEEVE> that is a bushing part around the shaft used to mount and position bearings, seals, possibly impellers, remaining rotor parts etc. and to protect the shaft from any product
A <SHAFT SPACER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPACER> intended to fix distance between items on the <SHAFT>
A <SHEAR RING> is a <RING> fixing end head and taking up a shear force
A <SHIP EMERGENCY GENERATOR ENGINE> is an <ENGINE> that is a driver for an emergency power generator on board a ship
A <SHIP FIRE WATER PUMP ENGINE> is an <ENGINE> that is a ship auxiliary engine utilized as the driving motor of a fire water pump on board a ship
A <SHIP MAIN GENERATOR DRIVER> is an <ENGINE> that is a driver for a main power generator on board a ship
A <SHIP PROPULSION ENGINE> is a <PROPULSION ENGINE> for a ship.
A <SHROUD BAND> is a <RING> intended to tie groups of turbine blades together
A <SHUT OFF DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <GAS FLOW DAMPER> intended for closing off parts of a ventilation system
A <SHUT OFF DAMPER MECHANICAL> is a <SHUT OFF DAMPER> that is mechanically operated

A <SIDE CHANNEL PUMP> is a <ROTARY PUMP> that allows for the transfer of liquid-gas mixtures with up to 50% vapor; therefore eliminating possible air or vapor locking that can occur in other pump designs
A <SIDE ENTRY MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that is placed at the correct angle at the side of a vessel intended to develop a top-to-bottom flow pattern in a liquid
A <SIDE LOAD INLET> is a <FLUID INLET PORT> to receive a main process stream intended as a side load in case of a compressor

A <SIMPLEX HEAD DIAPHRAGM PUMP> is a <CONTROLLED VOLUME DIAPHRAGM PUMP> that is sealless, using one mechanically or hydraulically actuated diaphragm pump heads. The drive system for the diaphragms is a common rugged triple throw crankshaft / cross head system.
A <SIMPLEX PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> with a single liquid cylinder

A <SINGLE ACTING PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> that takes a suction, filling the pump cylinder on the stroke in only one direction, called the suction stroke, and then forces the liquid out of the cylinder on the return stroke, called the discharge stroke.
A <SINGLE AXIS SWIVEL JOINT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SWIVEL JOINT> with parts that rotate around a single (common) axis
A <SINGLE COIL-SPRING MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> where the mating ring is pressed against the primary ring by the force from a single coil spring.
A <SINGLE CONNECTING ROD> is a <CONNECTING ROD> that is transmitting motion from the piston in a trunk motor to the crank
A <SINGLE DIAPHRAGM PUMP> is a <CONTROLLED VOLUME DIAPHRAGM PUMP> that contains one diaphragm per head
A <SINGLE DRY GAS SEAL> is a <DRY GAS SEAL> that is self-acting and has one seal face

A <SINGLE ENGAGEMENT COUPLING> is a <FLEXIBLE COUPLING> with only one plane of flexure. <NOTE>; Single engagement couplings of some types, notably gear and metallic flexible element types, will not normally accommodate parallel (or lateral) offset.
A<SINGLE ENTRY PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> by which the liquid enters the suction eye on one side only
A <SINGLE HELICAL GEARBOX> is a <HELICAL GEARBOX> that contains gear-wheels with a single set of helical teeth (slanting in one direction).
A <SINGLE HELICAL MIXER IMPELLER> is a <HELICAL MIXER IMPELLER> that has a single spiral-shaped blade.
A <SINGLE LOBE PUMP> is a <LOBE PUMP> in which each rotor is provided with one lobe.
A <SINGLE MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> that is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> containing one rotating- and one stationary seal face
A <SINGLE PIECE CAST CRANKTHROW> is a <SINGLE PIECE CRANKTHROW> that is made (machined) from one cast piece.
A <SINGLE PIECE CRANKSHAFT> is a <CRANKSHAFT> that is made out of one piece.
A <SINGLE PIECE CRANKTHROW> is a <CRANKTHROW> that is made from one piece only.
A <SINGLE PIECE ENGINE BLOCK> is a <PISTON ENGINE BLOCK> that is cast or made in one piece.
A <SINGLE PIECE FORGED CRANKTHROW> is a <SINGLE PIECE CRANKTHROW> that is made (machined) from one forged piece.
A <SINGLE ROW ANGULAR CONTACT BEARING> is an <ANGULAR CONTACT BALL BEARING> provided with a single row bearing balls and destined to accommodate for thrust loads in one direction.
A <SINGLE ROW BEARING> is a <ROLLING ELEMENT BEARING> provided with one row of rolling elements.
A <SINGLE SCREW EXTRUDER> is a <SCREW EXTRUDER> that contains one screw
A <SINGLE STAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> in which the head is developed by a single impeller.
A <SINGLE SUCTION PUMP IMPELLER> is a <PUMP IMPELLER> where the liquid enters the suction eye on one side only.

A <SINGLE TYPE CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> where a centrifugal pump is designed with a single wall casing surrounding the impeller. The suction and discharge nozzles form an integral part of the casing.
A <SINGLE VOLUTE> is a <VOLUTE> that is characterised by a symmetric pressure in the volute at the optimum efficiency point, which leads to zero radial load.

A <SINGLE VOLUTE TYPE CASING> is a <VOLUTE TYPE CASING> where the oulet channel has a single-volute wall only, which can result in radial reaction forces acting on the impeller when operating the pump at capacities outside the design point.

A <SIX STAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> in which the head is developed by six impellers operating in series (each taking its suction from the discharge of the preceding impeller)
A <SKID> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended to support items when being manufactured, transported, handled or installed
A <SKID ASSEMBLY> is a <SKID> and a <SYSTEM> consisting of a skid including other functional units mounted on the skid
A <SKID FRAME> is a <BASE FRAME> and a <SKID> that is the main support in a <SKID ASSEMBLY>.
A <SKID MOUNTED PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is mounted on a skid
A <SKID PLATE> is a <PLATE> and a <SKID> intended to support, lift and transport a smaller or larger group of equipment items
An <SLEEVE BEARING> is a <SLIDING TYPE BEARING> that is a bushing type bearing intended to carry primarily radial load and possibly axial load in addition.
A <SLEEVE GASKET> is a <GASKET> that is located underneath the shaft sleeve in the stuffing box and seals the shaft against the liquid to be pumped
An <SLEWING BEARING> is a <ROLLING ELEMENT BEARING> that contains one or more rows of rolling elements.
An <SLEWING MOTOR> is a <MOTOR> that is intended for turning something, or causing it to turn, without change of place
A <SLIDE RAIL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> intended for mounting an electric motor and that enables adjustment
A <SLIDE VALVE PUSH ROD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CONNECTOR> that provides the connection between an unloader piston and a sliding valve
A <SLIDING TYPE BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> that contains bearing bushings, pads or shoes to support and locate revolving, reciprocating and sliding elements

A <SLIDING VALVE> is a <PISTON> that is a rotating equipment component that is a specially formed piston which determines the effective volume ratios of the screws depending on the position of the sliding valve in order to control the flow rate.

A <SLIDING VANE PUMP> is a <VANE PUMP> that contains sliding vanes in radial slots in an eccentric rotor that moves outward due to a centrifugal force to form a seal with the casing; pumped fluid may contain gases or vapors; capacity may be changed by change in eccentricity or speed.
A <SLOT> is a <Feature> that is a narrow opening or groove
An <SLUDGE PUMP> is  a <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <PUMPING> <SLUDGE>
An <SMOKE HOOD> is a <HOOD> to be carried on the head capable of making man able to breath in an atmosphere filled with smoke.
A <SODIUM HYPOCHLORITE GENERATOR> i a <GENERATOR> that is designed to generate <SODIUM HYPOCHLORITE> from a solution of <WATER> with <SODIUM>
A <SOLAR GEARBOX> is an <EPICYCLIC GEARBOX> that contains a pinion that is fixed and a planet carrier which is integral with the output shaft.
A <SOLID BALL> is a <BALL> that is solid
A <SOLIDS MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> intended for use for solids suspension
A <SOUR SEAL OIL OUTLET> is a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> intended to drain seal oil contaminated with sour gas
A <SPACER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <SPACING>
A <SPACER CAN> is a <PUMP CAN> intended to serve as separation part between the internal rotor and the external driven rotor
A <SPACER CAN CLAMP RING> is a <RING> that tightens the spacer can to the casing cover
A <SPACER COUPLING> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that allows maintenance of bearings and seals without removing driver or driven equipment

A <SPARK ARRESTOR>  is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ARRESTOR> that removes incandescent particles from a gas stream. Spark arrestors are fitted to vehicles and stationary engines which are operated in potentially flammable atmospheres

SuperClass: CONTROLLER, INSTRUMENTATION ITEM, ROTATIONAL SPEED MEASURING INSTRUMENT
TextDefinition: A <SPEED CONTROLLER> is a <CONTROLLER> and an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <ROTATIONAL SPEED MEASURING INSTRUMENT>, is specially and exclusively designed to control a <SPEED>
A <SPEEDER ROD> is an <INSTRUMENT COMPONENT> that connects a governor and a speed changer/control valve mechanism
A <SPEEDER SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> intended to serve as setpoint reference for the governor travel based on spring force as function of spring compression

An <SPHERICAL PLAIN BEARING> is a <SLIDING TYPE BEARING> consisting of a cylindrical outer ring with a spherical supported inner ring. The bearing is suitable for alignment movements or oscillating, tilting and slewing movements.

An <SPHERICAL ROLLER BEARING> is a <ROLLER BEARING> provided with two rows of rollers with a common sphered raceway in the outer ring. The two inner ring raceways are inclined at an angle to the bearing axis. This bearing is of the self-aligning type and can also accommodate for limited axial loads in both directions.

An <SPHERICAL ROLLER THRUST BEARING> is a <ROLLER BEARING> utilizing spherical rollers between an outer and inner ring where the raceways are positioned at an angle to the bearing axis. These types of bearings can handle both axial and radial loads as well as misalignment to the shaft axis.
A <SPINDLE> is a <SHAFT> acting as a revolving axis or as a pin on which another element revolves.
A <SPIRAL BACKSWEPT TURBINE IMPELLER> is a <RADIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER> that is of the open type and provided with radially curved blades.
A <SPIRAL SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> formed by coiling a steel ribbon into an elongated flat spiral or a helix of increasing diameter
A <SPIRAL-BEVEL GEAR> is a <GEAR> that has spiral-bevel teeth.
A <SPIRAL-BEVEL GEARBOX> is a <CROSSED AXIS GEARBOX> where the input and output shafts normally are standing 90> deg. to each other utilizing a pinion and gear with spiral-bevel gear teeth.
An <SPLINE> is a <Feature> that is a number of relatively narrow key ways formed external on a shaft or internal inside the hole of a hub. Used instead of shaft key for maximum strength
A <SPLINED BORE COUPLING HUB> is a <COUPLING HUB> that has a splined bore
An <SPLINED SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> with a number of relatively narrow keys formed integral with the shaft , somewhat resembling long gear-teeth; produced by milling longitudinal grooves in the shaft.
An <SPLIT ENGINE BLOCK> is a <PISTON ENGINE BLOCK> that is split, i.e. it is made of more than one part.
An <SPLIT RIGID COUPLING> is a <RIGID COUPLING> which is split along its horizontal centerline and the two halves are clamped together by a series of bolts arranged axially alongside the coupling.
An <SPLITTER GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> with one input shaft and minimum two output shafts
An <SPRING LOADED ACCUMULATOR>> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <HYDRAULIC ACCUMULATOR> where the chock absorbing capabilities are achieved by a spring
An <SPRING LOADED GREASE TYPE LUBRICATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <LUBRICATOR> that supplies grease under pressure from a spring loaded piston
An <SPRING TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> is a <TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> where the turning mass is connected to the driver plate by means of a spring stiffness and damping
An <SPRINKLER VALVE SKID> is a <FIREWATER VALVE SKID> for sprinkler valves.
A <SPUR GEAR> is a <GEAR> where the contact with the mating gear occurs along the full length of the face at the same moment in time.

A <SPUR GEARBOX> is a <PARALLEL SHAFT GEARBOX> that contains gear-wheels with teeth parallel with the shaft axis. The contact between the mating gears occurs along the full length of the teeth-face at the same moment in time.

A <STABILIZER FIN> is a <FIN> that is mounted to the blades of a mixer impeller in order to increase system dampening by providing a surface area that opposes the lateral motion of the shaft and turbine
A <STAGE> is an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> that is that portion of a centrifugal pump or compressor consisting of one <IMPELLER> and its associated components

A <STAGE CASING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CASING> in which a certain amount of impellers or wheels are present, together forming one stage, and which is coupled to one or more casings to generate the overall required pressure in case of driven equipment and power in case of a driver
A <STAGE DRAIN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DRAIN CONNECTION POINT> intended to drain a fluid per stage

A <STAGGERED TYPE CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> where the volutes of a radially split multistage pump casing are orientated in opposite directions to balance out the resultant of the individual radial forces.

A <STAGGERED VOLUTE TYPE CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> where the volutes of a radially split multistage pump casing are orientated in opposite directions to balance out the resultant of the individual radial forces.
A <STAR ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> with an engine block where the cylinders are placed in a star configuration.
A <STAR ENGINE CYLINDER BLOCK> is a <PISTON ENGINE BLOCK> where the cylinders are placed in a star configuration.
A <STAR GEARBOX> is an <EPICYCLIC GEARBOX> that contains a planet wheel carrier that is fixed and an internal gear that rotates integrally with the output shaft.
A <STARTER> is a <FunctionalObject> that has the capability of <STARTING>
A <STARTING AIR SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <START SYSTEM> using pressurised air led directly into the engine cylinders to turn and start the engine
A <STARTING UNIT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STARTER> that is the unit intended to perform the starting of something
A <STATIC LABYRINTH SEAL> is a <LABYRINTH SEAL> that has teeth on a stationary internal
A <STATIONARY FACE SEAL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that provides a leak free joint of the stationary face of a mechanical seal into the seal end plate
A <STATIONARY TRANSPORT SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <TRANSPORT SYSTEM> that, as a whole, remains in one place
A <STATOR> is a <MACHINE COMPONENT> that is the arrangement of primary coils being the stator winding and being the stationary part of a machine
A <STATOR CAN> is a <PUMP CAN> that is the casing that houses the stator winding
A <STATOR VANE> is a <VANE> as part of a stator vane arrangement opposing a plurality of rotor vanes in rotating machinery
A <STEADY BEARING> is a <RADIAL BEARING> that is intended to be used for relatively long shafts for mixers to reduce the drive bearing reactions and gearing deflections.
A <STEAM CHEST> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <ENCLOSURE> intended to house governor valves in order to have admitted the correct steam flow to the turbine
A <STEAM DRIVEN DIRECT ACTING PUMP> is a <DIRECT ACTING PUMP> that is driven by pressurized steam
A <STEAM ENGINE> is an <ENGINE> powered by <STEAM>
A <STEAM PIPING SYSTEM> is a <PIPING SYSTEM> through which steam is transported.
A <STEAM STRAINER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRAINER> which is applied in the main inlet of a turbine
A <STEAM SYSTEM> is a <SYSTEM> for generation and distribution of steam

A <STEAM TURBINE> is a <TURBINE> that is a heat engine in which energy of steam is transformed into kinetic energy by means of expansion through nozzles and the kinetic energy of the resulting jet is in turn converted into force doing work on rings of blading mounted on a rotating shaft

A <STEAM TURBINE DIAPHRAGM> is a <DIAPHRAGM> that is a partition between pressure stages in a turbine's casing. Diaphragms hold the vane-shaped nozzles and seals between the stages. Usually labyrinth-type seals are used. One-half of the diaphragm is fitted into the top of the casing, the other half into the bottom.
A <STEP-DOWN GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is intended to increase torque and reduce speed
A <STEP-UP GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> that is intended to reduce torque and increase speed

An <STIRLING ENGINE> is an <EXTERNAL COMBUSTION ENGINE> that is a reciprocating engine consisting essentially of a cylinder with a working piston and a displacer. When the gas in the cylinder is heated it expands, driving the working piston. The displacer then transfers the gas to a cold region for cooling; it is then recompressed by the working piston and transferred by the displacer to the hot region to start the cycle again.
A <STRAIGHT-BEVEL GEARBOX> is a <CROSSED AXIS GEARBOX> where the input and output shafts normally are standing 90> deg. to each other utilizing a pinion and gear with straight-bevel gear teeth.

A <STRAIGHT-FLOW BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE> is a <BACK PRESSURE STEAM TURBINE> where all the steam enters the turbine at one pressure level and all the steam leaves the turbine at a pressure equal to or above atmospheric pressure

A <STRAIGHT-FLOW CONDENSING STEAM TURBINE> is a <CONDENSING STEAM TURBINE> where all the steam enters the turbine at one pressure level and all the steam leaves the turbine at a pressure below atmospheric pressure
A <STRAIGHT-LOBE COMPRESSOR> is a <ROTARY COMPRESSOR> in which two timed straight mating lobed rotors trap gas and carry it from inlet to discharge.
A <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <STRUCTURE> that is an arrangement and organization of interrelated <ARTEFACT>s
A <STUFFING BOX> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that utilizes several coils of woven material pressed lightly against the rotating shaft to provide a minimal leakage path between the shaft and casing
A <STUFFING BOX COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is intended to serve either as covering flange to fixate and press the packing rings together or housing the mechanical seal
A <STUFFING BOX JACKET> is a <JACKET> that is a chamber in a stuffing box intended to circulate a cooling or heating fluid as the case may be
A <STUFFING BOX PACKING RING> is a <PACKING RING> that is intended to seal between a rotating or reciprocating shaft and a casing or between a valve stem and a valve body.
A <SUBMERSIBLE PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is capable of operating when submerged in the liquid it is intended to pump
A <SUBSEA GUIDE FUNNEL> is a <GUIDE FUNNEL> that is attached to a subsea structure to provide guidance for installing equipemnt from the surface
A <SUBSEA PIG LAUNCHER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PIG LAUNCHER> located on the sebed at the end of a pipeline, usually a pipeline end terminal
A <SUBSEA PIG RECEIVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PIG RECEIVER> located on the seabed at the end of a pipeline, usually a pipeline end terminal
A <SUBSEA STRUCTURE> is a <STRUCTURE(mechanical)> for use in a subsea environment
A <SUCTION BELL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FLUID CONTAINER> that is the suction inlet part for the first impeller to guide the liquid to be pumped
A <SUCTION BOWL> is a <PUMP BOWL> that is a special inlet casing to house an impeller and to guide a pumped liquid.
A <SUCTION CAN> is a <PUMP BARREL> intended to serve as suction barrel below grade in case of a vertical pump, collecting and leading the fluid to the pump inlet.
A <SUCTION COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is a removable part of a pressurized casing with a special shape suitable to serve as suction inlet
A <SUCTION NOZZLE> is a <NOZZLE> that provides a suction inlet
A <SUCTION PIPING SYSTEM> is a <PIPING SYSTEM> through which fluid is transported to the suction side of any piece of equipment.

A <SUCTION THROTTLING CONTROL SYSTEM> is a <CAPACITY CONTROL> that enables to vary the capacity in case of centrifugal compressors by which suction throttling takes place by either a fixed orifice (permanent fixed throttling) or by closing the suction valve at inlet gradually (variable throttling) in order to reduce the inlet pressure and hence the outlet pressure with the results that the compressor capacity lowers at original outlet pressure; the valve system is activated by means of manual or automatic control on basis of pre-set positions.
A <SUCTION VALVE UNLOADING SYSTEM> is a <PIPING SYSTEM> that is a control system that contains the manual/automatic setpoint operators in conjunction with the electronic/pneumatic control logic.
A <SUMP> is a <RESERVOIR> intended to collect the heavier phase, e.g holding liquid
A <SUMP MOUNTED CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> that is suitable for mounting in a <SUMP>
A <SUMP PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that is working in a <SUMP> to elevate liquid.
A <SUN AND PLANET GEAR> is a <GEAR> that converts reciprocating motion to rotary motion by fixing a planet gear at the end of the reciprocating rod and a sun gear fixed at the output shaft

A <SUPERCHARGER> is a <TURBOCHARGER> intended to pump a fuel/air mixture into the cylinders of an internal combustion engine under pressure. It is similar in purpose to a turbocharger, but differs in that the supercharger is powered by gearing (or belts) off the engine's crankshaft, while the turbocharger is powered by the pressure of exhaust gases.
A <SUPER-SINUS SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> formed by several sinus shaped rings made of flat spring wire. The one-piece spring is endless and has a very flat characteristic

A <THRUST BALL BEARING> is a <BALL BEARING> and a <THRUST BEARING> that contains a ball and cage thrust assembly between a shaft washer and a housing washer with raceway grooves. This type of bearings is suitable for axial loads in one direction and may not be subject to any radial load.
A <THRUST BASE RING> is a <RING> intended to carry pads
A <THRUST BEARING> is an<ARTEFACT> and a <BEARING> used to accommodate for any residual axial load within any rotating equipment design under all possible operating conditions
A <THRUST BEARING ASSEMBLY> is an <ASSEMBLY> and associated parts
A <THRUST BEARING BRACKET> is a <BEARING BRACKET> that is a support for a thrust bearing assembly.
A <THRUST BEARING DRIVEN END> is a <THRUST BEARING> that is located at the driven end of a shaft.
A <THRUST BEARING GLAND> is a <GLAND> intended to position the non-rotating part of the thrust bearing to the bearing head.
A <THRUST BEARING HOUSING> is a <BEARING HOUSING> intended to house a thrust bearing.
A <THRUST BEARING NON-DRIVEN END> is a <THRUST BEARING> that is located at the non-driven end of a shaft.

A <THRUST BEARING PAD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SUPPORT> that is a thrust bearing component that consists of segments of a bearing sleeve mounted in a housing being able to transfer load from the shaft
A <THRUST BEARING PLATE> is a <PLATE> intended to accommodate for residual axial load within a canned motor design
A <THRUST COLLAR> is a <COLLAR> that is a flange or a sleeve intended to prevent axial displacement of a rotating mechanical component.
A <THRUST COLLAR ASSEMBLY> is an <ASSEMBLY> of a <REPLACEABLE THRUST COLLAR> and associated <LOCK NUT>s
A <THRUST COLLAR LOCK NUT> is a <LOCK NUT ASSEMBLY> that fastens a <THRUST COLLAR> to a <SHAFT>
A <THRUST PLAIN BEARING> is a <PLAIN BEARING> and a <THRUST BEARING>
A <THRUST RING> is a <RING> that accommodates for small residual axial loads and is typically used in stuffing box assemblies
A <THRUST ROLLER BEARING> is a <ROLLER BEARING> and a <THRUST BEARING>
A <THRUST SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> between crankshaft and driven (propeller) shaft to take up thrust forces.
A <THRUST SHIM> is a <SHIM PLATE> intended to fix the axial position of a <ROTOR>
A <THRUST SLEEVE BEARING> is a <SLEEVE BEARING> and a <THRUST BEARING>

A <THRUSTER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PROPULSION SYSTEM> that includes a water jet or propeller used on vessels intended to provide a means to move the vessel sideways for maintaining the vessels position without anchors
A <THRUSTER ENGINE> is  an <ENGINE> that is an auxiliary engine utilized as the driving motor of a thruster

A <TILTING PAD> is a <MACHINE COMPONENT> that is a segment of a bearing sleeve of a tilting pad bearing mounted in a housing being able to tilt to the most naturally appropriate angle for lubricant to accept the bearing load between the pads and the shaft or thrust disc. The pad pivots about a central point to align with direction of maximum loading
A <TILTING PAD BEARING> is a <SLIDING TYPE BEARING> that contains tilted bearing pads to allow oil wedges to form between the pads and the rotor.
A <TILTING PAD COMBINED RADIAL/THRUST BEARING> is a <TILTING PAD BEARING> intended to provide both radial and axial support to a rotating component.
A <TILTING PAD RADIAL BEARING> is a <TILTING PAD BEARING> intended to provide radial support to a rotating component.
A <TILTING PAD THRUST BEARING> is a <TILTING PAD BEARING> and a <THRUST BEARING> where the bearing pads tilt to allow oil wedges to form between the pad and thrust disc.

A <TIMING GEAR> is a <GEAR> intended to transmit torque from one rotor shaft to another, and to maintain the proper angular relationship between rotors. It is located outside the rotating equipment (pump or compressor) chamber.
A <TOP ENTRY MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that is located at the top of a vessel
A <TOP SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is coupled between lower pump shaft and spacer on electric motor shaft.
A <TORQUE FLOW PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> with a recessed impeller for grit handling
A <TORSION SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> bar anchored at one end, is subjected to torsion, and thereby acting as a spring
A <TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VIBRATION DAMPER> that reduces torsional vibrations in a crankshaft

A <TORSIONALLY RESILIENT COUPLING> is a <FLEXIBLE COUPLING> incorporating increased torsional flexibility and/or torsional damping. A torsionally resilIent coupling may or may not also be designed to accommodate misalignment and/or axial displacement.
A <TRACK RUNNER BEARING> is a <ROLLING ELEMENT BEARING> that contains a deep groove ball bearing or a roller bearing with a thick-walled outer ring.
A <TRANSMISSION> is a <MECHANICAL POWER TRANSMISSION COUPLING> that is intended to transmit power from a driver to a piece of driven equipment

A <TRANSMISSION SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <ROTATING EQUIPMENT SYSTEM> intended to transmit power from the driver shaft onto the driven equipment shaft either or not at the same speed and related torque, by means of an assembly of transmission components and auxiliaries

A <TRANSPORT PACKAGE> is a <PACKAGE ASSEMBLY> that is a bundle of things packed up for transportation, whether in a box or other receptacle, or merely compactly tied up; esp. such a bundle of small or moderate size, as an item of luggage; a packet, parcel.
A <TRIPLE DIAPHRAGM PUMP> is a <CONTROLLED VOLUME DIAPHRAGM PUMP> that contains three diaphragms per head

A <TRIPLE DRY GAS SEAL> is a <DRY GAS SEAL> that is a self-acting arrangement by which two seals are needed to step down the relatively high pressure in equal stages with a third seal acting as a back-up seal.

A <TRIPLE MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <DRY GAS SEAL> that is a dry gas seal arrangement by which two seals are needed to step down the relatively high pressure in equal stages with a third seal acting as a back-up seal.

UniqueName: TRIPLE MECHANICAL SEAL WITH PUMPING RING
TextDefinition: A <TRIPLE MECHANICAL SEAL WITH PUMPING RING> is a <TRIPLE MECHANICAL SEAL> where a pumping ring is mounted between the two seals to boost the circulation of buffer fluid.

UniqueName: TRIPLE MECHANICAL SEAL WITHOUT PUMPING RING
TextDefinition: A <TRIPLE MECHANICAL SEAL WITHOUT PUMPING RING> is a <TRIPLE MECHANICAL SEAL> without a pumping ring mounted between the seals. The circulation of buffer fluid is taken care of by an external system.
A <TRIPLE SCREW PUMP> is a <SCREW PUMP> that contains three screw-rotors.

A <TRIPLEX HEAD DIAPHRAGM PUMP> is a <CONTROLLED VOLUME DIAPHRAGM PUMP> that is sealless and contains three mechanically or hydraulically actuated diaphragm pump heads. The drive system for the diaphragms is a common rugged triple throw crankshaft / cross head system
A <TRIPLEX POWER PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> with three plungers or pistons working in three cylinders
A <TURBINE> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DRIVER(function)> that is a rotary mechanical device that extracts energy from a fluid flow and converts it into useful work

A <TURBINE BLADE> is a <VANE> that is mounted on a wheel in order to have high pressure steam expanded to generate power a vane that is mounted on a wheel in order to have high pressure steam expanded to generate power.
A <TURBINE BLADING> is an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> that is a collection of blades mounted on a wheel in order to enable high pressure steam expanding to generate power
A <TURBINE IMPULSE BLADE> is a <TURBINE BLADE> where the pressure level across the moving blading drops hardly.
A <TURBINE IMPULSE BLADING> is a <TURBINE BLADING> that is a collection of turbine impulse blades mounted on a wheel in order to have high pressure steam expanded to generate power
A <TURBINE INNER BARREL> is a <CASING> that contains the stationary internals of a turbine, and that is cartridge mounted for withdrawal from the outer shell of a radial split casing
A <TURBINE METER SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> designed to be used in a turbine flow meter.
A <TURBINE REACTION BLADE> is a <TURBINE BLADE> where the pressure level across the moving blades drops.
A <TURBINE REACTION BLADING> is a <TURBINE BLADING> that is a collection of turbine reaction blades mounted on a wheel in order to have high pressure steam expanded to generate power
A <TURBINE SYSTEM> is a <TRUBINE> and a <ROTATING EQUIPMENT SYSTEM>, consisting of one or more <BARE TURBINE>s and auxilliary systems and parts
A <TURBINE WHEEL> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WHEEL> that is a carrier for turbine blading
A <TURBO CHARGED ENGINE> is a <PISTON ENGINE> eqipped with a compressor to supply air or combustible mixture to the cyliner(s).
A <TURBO EXPANDER> is a <TURBINE> and an <EXPANDER> through which a high-pressure gas is expanded to produce work

A <TURBOCHARGER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> intended to increase the inlet pressure of air for internal combustion engines by which the power to drive the turbocharger is coming from a turbine driven by the exhaust gases
A <TURBOCHARGER COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> that is the compressor part of a turbocharger intended to increase the pressure of the combustion air to a combustion engine
A <TURBOCHARGER SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> that is the main common shaft in a turbocharger driving and supporting the turbocharger compressor as well as the tubocharger turbine.
A <TURBOCHARGER TURBINE is a <TURBINE> that is utilized as driver of a turbocharger compressor, and in which rotary motion is produced by the exhaust gases from a combustion engine
A <TURNING GEAR> is a <GEAR> that is cut in either after turbine set shutdown or prior to start up turbine set to avoid casing and shaft distortions due to hazardous thermal stratifications.
A <TWIN AGENT SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> that supports a Twin Agent Fire Extinguishing System (TAFES)
A <TWIN FLIGHT MIXER> is a <DYNAMIC MIXER> that moves the entire mixture in a three-dimensional spiral motion
A <TWIN SCREW EXTRUDER> is a <SCREW EXTRUDER> that contains two cooperating screws
A <TWIN SCREW PUMP> is a <SCREW PUMP> that contains two screw-rotors
A <TWO LOBE PUMP> is a <LOBE PUMP> of which each rotor is provided with two lobes.
A <TWO STAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <MULTISTAGE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that contains two impellers to develop the head
A <TWO STAGE PUMP> is a <MULTISTAGE PUMP> that contains two stages to develop the head
A <TWO STROKE ENGINE> is an <ENGINE> by which during the 2 strokes per revolution suction, compression, ignition, expansion and gas discharge takes place
A <U-CUP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SEAL> that is a flexible gasket, u-shaped and located between the spring holder and the rotating face
An <UNBALANCED SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> in which the seal face area, to a certain extent, is exposed to forces caused by the hydraulic pressure within the seal chamber
A <UNIDIRECTIONAL MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> that allows rotation in one direction only.

UniqueName: UNIDIRECTIONAL MECHANICAL SEAL FOR CCW ROTATION
TextDefinition: A <UNIDIRECTIONAL MECHANICAL SEAL FOR CCW ROTATION> is a <UNIDIRECTIONAL MECHANICAL SEAL> that allows for rotation in counterclockwise direction only.

UniqueName: UNIDIRECTIONAL MECHANICAL SEAL FOR CW ROTATION
TextDefinition: A <UNIDIRECTIONAL MECHANICAL SEAL FOR CW ROTATION> is a <UNIDIRECTIONAL MECHANICAL SEAL> that allows for rotation in clockwise direction only.
A <UNIVERSAL JOINT> is a <FLEXIBLE COUPLING> is coupling devices that transmit torque and rotary motion from one shaft to another at fixed or varying angles of intersection
A <UNLOADER COVER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COVER> that is used for the unloader cylinder of a screw compressor containing the roller bearing assembly for the unloader indicator spindle
An <UNLOADER CYLINDER> is a <MECHANICAL CYLINDER> in which unloader piston and push rod are positioned by means of pressurized gas or liquid
An <UNLOADER INDICATOR ASSEMBLY> is an <INSTRUMENTATION ITEM> and a <POSITION MEASURING ELEMENT> that converts the mechanical position of the sliding valve into an electrical signal,
A <UNLOADER INDICATOR SPINDLE> is a <SPINDLE> that converts the axial position of the slide valve push rod into a rotational movement which is transported to the unloader indicator assembly.
A <UNLOADER PISTON> is a <PISTON> that positions the sliding valve push rod by means of pressurized liquid or gas.

An <UPPER HALF CASING> is a <CASING> that is a section that is of a compressor or turbine casing, and that is the top half containing upper half diaphragms fastened in such a manner that they can be lifted with the casing as a unit
A <VACUUM PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> that utilizes a liquid annulus held by centrifugal force around the inside of a casing by a single rotor-impeller to compress vapour isothermically
A <VALVE INLET PORT> is a <FLUID INLET PORT> that is giving access to a <VALVE BODY>
A <VALVE OUTLET> is a <FLUID OUTLET PORT> hat allows for exit of a fluid from a <VALVE BODY>

A <VALVE OUTLET DIFFUSER> is a <FLOW MODIFICATION ACCESSORY> and a <DIFFUSER>  that comprises a perforated plate, tube insert or similar construction of a fixed area that is mounted downstream of the valve body assembly
A <VANE> is a <PLATE> intended to serve as an energy transfer element. Typically curved and part of a stator or rotor

A <VANE COMPRESSOR> is a <ROTARY COMPRESSOR> which contains vanes sliding radially in and out of a rotor excentrically mounted within a cylindrical casing. Gas trapped between the vanes is compressed and displaced.

A <VANE PUMP> is a <ROTARY PUMP> that contains a vane or vanes which may be in the form of blades, buckets, rollers or slippers, cooperating with a cam to draw liquid into and force it out of <PUMP> chamber. The vanes can be located either in the stator or rotor.
A <VANE SPRING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <SPRING> used as a tension spring behind the vane or blade in a <VANE PUMP>

A <VAPOR BARRIER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <BARRIER> which is a layer of material (as roofing paper or polyethylene film) used to retard or prevent the absorption of moisture into a construction (as a wall or floor)
A <VAPOR SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> that prevents vapor leakage.

A <VARIABLE PITCH BLADE> is a <FAN BLADE> by which the pitch of the blades is varied under control of a controller according to the speed of subject rotating machinery; the controller is programmed to respond to increased rotating machinery speed by decreasing pitch of the fan blades

A <VARIABLE PITCH BLADE MIXER IMPELLER> is an <AXIAL FLOW MIXER IMPELLER> that has a variable pitch, from hub to blade tip, but constant blade angle in order to produce a variable pitch-velocity discharge and variable shear rates across the impeller diameter.
A <VARIABLE SPEED FLUID COUPLING> is <FLUID COUPLING> driven by a constant speed driver allowing to transmit power at variable speed; the coupling has a inbuilt mechanism to change speed
A <VARIABLE SPEED GEARBOX> is a <GEARBOX> where the output speed can be changed without steps over a range
A <VARIABLE TRANSMISSION> is a <TRANSMISSION> that provides stepless speed control to a shaft of driven equipment
A <VARIABLE VOLUME PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> varying the pumped liquid volume by varying the rotational speed of the pump impeller
A <VARIOMATIC> is a <VARIABLE TRANSMISSION> that provides stepless speed control to a shaft of driven equipment
A <V-BELT> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <DRIVE BELT> with a V shape designed to fit in a groove of a pulley, used to transmit power or torque from the driving component to the driven component
A <V-BELT PULLEY> is a <PULLEY> intended to drive a V-belt
A <VELOCITY COMPOUND TURBINE> is a <STEAM TURBINE> where the pressure drop is in the nozzle only and the velocity is absorbed in a number of both fixed nozzles and bladed wheels
A <V-ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> in which the cylinders are arranged in two rows with a  60 degrees or 90 degrees angle
A <V-ENGINE CYLINDER BLOCK> is a <PISTON ENGINE BLOCK> where the cylinders forms a V configuration.

A <VENT CONNECTION POINT> is a <FLUID CONNECTION POINT> and a <VENT PORT> that allows for <CONNECTING> a <FLUID CONDUCTOR> for any vented <FLUID>; the vent is primarily used to expel air trapped in the system
A <VENT PORT> is a <GAS OUTLET PORT> that allows for <VENTING> a <PhysiccalObject>
A <VENTILATION AIR INLET> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATION PORT> function that allows for entry of air into a <ROOM>
A <VENTILATION FAN> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <FAN> intended to be used for ventilation

A <VENTILATION HOOD> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATING DEVICE> and an <EXTRACTOR> in which air is drawn in from the front of the hood by a fan, and either expelled outside the building or made safe through filtration and fed back into the room
A <VENTILATION PORT> is a <GAS PORT> that is intended to be connected to a vent
A <VENTILATOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <VENTILATING DEVICE> that is for introducing fresh air or expelling foul or stagnant air

A <VERTICAL BARREL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <VERTICAL LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is of the suspended type and provided with a suction barrel (can) and a discharge column below grade and a nozzle head with suction- and discharge flange above grade; impeller inlet below grade. The nozzle head serves as motor stool. Pump is of the dry pit type.

UniqueName: VERTICAL BARREL DIFFUSER TYPE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
TextDefinition: A <VERTICAL BARREL DIFFUSER TYPE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <VERTICAL BARREL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> by which the pumping section is of the diffuser pump design

UniqueName: VERTICAL BARREL VOLUTE TYPE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
TextDefinition: A <VERTICAL BARREL VOLUTE TYPE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <VERTICAL BARREL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> by which the pumping section is of the diffuser pump design
A <VERTICAL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <VERTICAL PUMP>  whose orientation is vertical
A <VERTICAL DRY PIT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <VERTICAL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> where the pumped liquid is led directly into the pump suction.
A <VERTICAL INLINE PUMP> is a <VERTICAL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> with a vertical axis shaft and side connections which allow removal of internals without disconnecting from the piping.

SuperClass: LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP, VERTICAL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
TextDefinition: A <VERTICAL LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <VERTICAL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is provided with a column below grade including either an open or enclosed lineshaft and by which the discharge opening is located above the mounting plate at grade

UniqueName: VERTICAL LINE SHAFT DIFFUSER TYPE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
TextDefinition: A <VERTICAL LINE SHAFT DIFFUSER TYPE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <VERTICAL TURBINE PUMP> of which the pumping section is of the diffuser pump design

UniqueName: VERTICAL LINE SHAFT VOLUTE TYPE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP
TextDefinition: A <VERTICAL LINE SHAFT VOLUTE TYPE CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <VERTICAL TURBINE PUMP> of which the pumping section is of the volute pump design
A <VERTICAL MOUNTED CASING> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <CASING> that is supported and positioned vertically to house vertical oriented equipment
A <VERTICAL MOUNTED PUMP CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> that is supported vertically to house vertical pumps.
A <VERTICAL PUMP> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <PUMP> where the pump shaft is vertically oriented

A <VERTICAL SUSPENDED CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <VERTICAL CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> whose liquid end is suspended from a column and a mounting plate. The pump can be driven either from the top through a long shaft or by a submerged motor.

A <VERTICAL TURBINE PUMP> is a <VERTICAL LINE SHAFT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> that is provided with either an open or enclosed lineshaft and by which the pumping section is of the single or multi-stage design; pump is of the wet pit design
A <VERTICAL WET PIT CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> is a <CENTRIFUGAL PUMP> and a <VERTICAL PUMP> where the pump is fully or partially submerged in the liquid to be pumped
A <VIBRATION DAMPER> is a <DAMPER> that has the capability of <DAMPING> vibrations and oscillations
A <VISCOUS SHEAR TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> is a <TORSIONAL VIBRATION DAMPER> that uses viscous fluid as damping medium
A <VOLUTE> is an <EQUIPMENT COMPONENT> that is a curved funnel that increases in area as it approaches the discharge port, used to change kinetic energy into potential energy
A <VOLUTE PUMP> is a <RADIAL FLOW PUMP> with a single volute type casing

A <VOLUTE TYPE CASING> is a <PUMP CASING> which has a spiral-shape and surrounds a pump impeller and includes an outlet channel, that is gradually increasing the cross-sectional arean of flow, to convert parts of the kinetic energy of the liquid into pressure energy.

A <WANKEL ENGINE> is a <ROTATING PISTON ENGINE> having an approximately triangular central rotor geared epitrochoidally to the central driving shaft and turning in a close-fitting oval-shaped chamber so that the power stroke is applied to each of the three faces of the rotor in turn as they pass a single sparking plug.

A <WAREHOUSE OR SHELTERED STORAGE SYSTEM> is a <BUILDING(structure)> and a <PRODUCT STORAGE SYSTEM> including systems which house all facilities weather of mobile or resident nature. Can be regarded as an integrated part of warehouse storage installation
A <WASHING SYSTEM> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WASTE DISPOSAL SYSTEM> intended to wash and clean whats necesarry
A <WATER COOLED MOTOR> is a <PISTON ENGINE>, or an Electric Motor, which is using water as the primary coolant
A <WATER INJECTION PUMP is a centrifugal or positive displacemen <PUMP> that is specifically designed for <INJECTING> <WATER>
A <WATER MAKER> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <WATER PURIFIER> used to obtain potable water by reverse osmosis of seawater. In boating and yachting circles
A <WATER MIST SKID> is a <SKID ASSEMBLY> containing the units required to operate a water mist system

A <WATER TURBINE> is a <HYDRAULIC TURBINE> that contains a wheel or runner which carries curved vanes or buckets and is supplied with water directed by a number of stationary guide vanes or hit by a high pressure water jet, intended to recover energy and to serve as a driver
A <WEAR RING> is a <RING> which seals the leakage path and provides a wearable contact surface.
A <WELDED CASING> is a <CASING> that is constructed and fabricated by welding of parts.
A <WELDED ENGINE BED PLATE> is a <PISTON ENGINE BED PLATE> that is made of welded steel.
A <WELDED IMPELLER> is an <ARTEFACT> and an <IMPELLER> that is constructed and fabricated by welding of parts
A <WELDED TAPERLOCK BOSS> is a <TAPERLOCK BOSS> intended for being welded on to wheel.
A <W-ENGINE> is a <RECIPROCATING PISTON ENGINE> with an engine block where the cylinders forms a W configuration.
A <W-ENGINE CYLINDER BLOCK> is a <PISTON ENGINE BLOCK> where the cylinders forms a W configuration.
A <WET BOLTING> is a <BOLT> that is in contact with the process liquid
A <WET CYLINDER LINER> is a <CYLINDER LINER> that is cooled through direct contact with the cooling water.
A <WET GAS COMPRESSOR> is an <ARTEFACT> and a <COMPRESSOR> that is used for handling wet gas

A <WET ROTATING SEAT MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> where the mating ring (seat ring) is rotating with the shaft and the sealing faces are lubricated by the product or by the buffer fluid.The springs are protected from the medium. This design is used in high speed/high pressure applications.
A <WET RUNNING MECHANICAL SEAL> is a <MECHANICAL SEAL> where the product forms a thin liquid film between the seal faces intended to prevent heat of friction.

A <WHEEL AND BUCKET PUMP> is a <ROTARY PUMP> with an endless chain provided with one or more buckets and positioned on a series of wheels; on the lower end of the chain the buckets dip into the liquid; at the upper end the buckets are turning over and the liquid is discharged at the top.
A <WIND TURBINE> is  a <TURBINE> that converts the kinetic energy of the wind into electrical power
A <WING PUMP> is a <RECIPROCATING PUMP> that is provided with plate valves which are opened and closed in turn hydraulically by means of a handle in order to displace the liquid to be pumped.
A <WIRE> is an <ARTEFACT> which is a metal wrought into the form of a slender rod or thread, formely by hammering, now by the operation of wire-drawing
A <WORM GEAR> is a <CROSSED AXIS GEARBOX> where the input and output shaft normally are standing 90> deg. to each other utilizing a worm where it' teeth slides against the gear teeth when it rotates.

A <WORM GEARBOX> is a <CROSSED AXIS GEARBOX> that contains an input and output shaft that form an angle to each other, typically of 90> degree, and that contains a worm which teeth slides against the gear teeth when it rotates.
A <WORM SHAFT> is a <SHAFT> intended to drive and support a worm in a worm gear assembly.
A <WORM WHEEL> is a <GEAR> that has a concave face.

A <Y-BEARING UNIT> is a <RADIAL/THRUST BALL BEARING> that is a simple economic ball bearing unit consisting of a deep groove ball bearing and a bearing housing made of cast iron or pressed steel having a sphered bore enabling the unit to allow moderate errors of alignment.
A <YOKE> is an <ARTEFACT> that is an arched device intended to embrace two parts to hold or unite them in position, or to divide loads
A <YOKE BUSH> is a <BUSHING> that is screwed, and is retained in a yoke to which a hand wheel or actuator is connected. Rotation of the bush is intended to cause a valve stem to move up or down.
A <ZEROL GEAR> is a <GEAR> that has curved teeth.
A <ZEROL GEARBOX> is a <CROSSED AXIS GEARBOX> that has an input and output shaft that forms an angle to each other, typically of 90> degree, and contains a pinion and gear with curved gear teeth.
A <ZOELLY-RATEAU TURBINE> is an <IMPULSE STEAM TURBINE> that is provided with more than one pressure stage, each followed by a velocity stage
